description:
SOVEREIGN is an extraordinary yacht that was built to rival the quality and capability of the Northern European pedigree shipyards. She was built by an experienced yachtsman who made sure the build included every opportunity to be successful by providing the finest supervision, engineering, design, time and quality material available. Time of build was of no concern and quality was number one priority. The owner spared no cost in getting the vessel perfect before putting her in operation. Her second and present owner has been the perfect custodian offering SOVEREIGN the “state of the art” upgrades, annual surveys both maintenance and class, providing the vessel with whatever was needed. A listing of the upgrades are found further in the listing spec.

SOVEREIGN offers six large staterooms with two true masters. She offers volume not seen on a 55m with additional attributes to include 1,100 GRT, elevator, beach club, high ceilings, huge exterior deck space, four fin Quantum zero stabilization, recent five year ABS survey complete, fresh superstructure paint, extended Caterpillar warranty until November 2021 with unlimited hours and much much more. A must see. You will not be disappointed.

descriptions.title: Detailed Information
descriptions.description:
OVERVIEW
SOVEREIGN is a fantastic yacht that was built to rival the quality and capability of the Northern European pedigree shipyards. She was built by an experienced yachtsman who made sure the build included every opportunity to be successful by providing the finest supervision, engineering, designer, time and quality available. Time of build was of no concern and quality was the number one priority. The owner spared no cost in getting the vessel perfect before putting her in operation.

Her second and present owner has been the perfect custodian offering SOVEREIGN the “state of the art” upgrades, annual surveys both maintenance and class, providing the vessel with whatever was needed. A list of the upgrades are found further in the listing spec.

SOVEREIGN has the volume of a 60m plus vessel. Her 180’ (55m) length and 34’ (10.4m) beam give her the platform that measuring 1,100 gross tons further this volume offers SOVEREIGN with a floor plan of over 8,000 square feet (750 square meters) provides an exceptional living area that accommodates two master staterooms, an additional four guest staterooms below and room for 14 crew. The exceptional spaciousness is most notable in the panoramic skylounge where the vaulted ceiling reaches greater than 10' high.

Her interior wood package built by Zepsa USA is another example of spare no expense to get the best quality possible in the vessel. The woodwork is complimented by warm marble surfaces, quality soft goods and furnishing. SOVEREIGN has an elegant and comfortable feel to her throughout.

SOVEREIGN’s stability and sea keeping is found in her massive platform and complemented by her 4 fin Quantum Zero Speed Stabilizers. She is ready to cruise any ocean in a minute’s notice.

SOVEREIGN highlights and adulates:
• Showboats Design Awards 2012 FINALIST - Naval Architecture Award: Motor Yachts
• World Superyacht Awards 2012 FINALIST - Best Displacement Motor Yacht of 500GT to 1,299GT
• First Place in both "Best Overall Design" and "Chic Outdoors" for the FLIBS Top Notch Tabletop competition
• (2) Master Staterooms one on main deck and one on upper bridge deck
• Quantum 4 fin zero speed stabilizers
• Extended Caterpillar warranty until November 2021 with unlimited hours
• Guest 4-deck elevator
• Huge 1,100 gross ton volume with over 8,000 sqft (750 sqmt) living space
• Large tender garage that converts to a Beach Club or Gym with full head and shower
• Panoramic sky lounge with vaulted ceilings that reach greater than 10 feet in height
• High quality pedigree yacht
• Designed and engineered by Murray Associates
• Large infinity edge Jacuzzi/pool
• Intermediate ABS survey complete (Dec 2019)
• MCA compliant
• Both generators completely overhauled (Dec 2019)

2020 Refit to include
• New hull paint
• Galley upgraded
• Bridge upgraded
• Crestron and AV upgraded
• Electrical panels upgraded


ACCOMMODATIONS
SOVEREIGN is designed to carry an owner's party of fourteen (14) with six (6) owner and guest staterooms. Her accommodations consist of two master staterooms, one on the upper deck with 270 degree panoramic views and the other a full beam stateroom on the main deck featuring eight oval windows approximately 2' tall for spectacular ocean views, both with his and her baths and ample hanging and drawer storage. Below deck there are four (4) guest staterooms, consisting of a VIP stateroom with king berth and his and her baths, a large guest stateroom with king berth and spacious head and two (2) twin staterooms, each with a full, twin and Pullman berth. From the below accommodations there is a service passageway through to the crew. The crew areas accommodations support up to fourteen crew members in seven cabins total.

When you enter the yacht’s main aft deck you will find a very large seating area with multiple tables and settees comfortably hosting any size group. Through the main aft doors and past the marbled foyer is an expansive main salon and separate dining area which conveniently resides next to the main deck pantry and ship’s galley. The forward part of this deck is home to one of the 2 master staterooms. In the middle of this deck you will find the large open stairwell next to the elevator which gives you two ways to access all other interior decks. The elevator goes from the tank deck where freezers and provision are found to the bridge where the second master and skylounge are found.

The upper deck has a panoramic sky lounge area featuring greater than 10' of headroom at the center. The sky lounge salon is double the size of the main salon and serves as the primary social area of the yacht with incredible views, a large bar, a nearby service pantry and quick access to the upper aft deck. The upper aft deck has a large, circular alfresco dining table for elegant outdoor dining. Aft of the table are several large lounges and tables to relax outside in privacy, out of view from the dock.

The ship’s bridge is one level up in transition to the incredible sun deck. The sun deck has even more inviting social areas, including bar chairs, massive elevated forward observation/sun deck, day head, outdoor shower, full service wet, 46" Sunbrite TV, bar and a beautifully tiled, oversized infinity edge pool/Jacuzzi with bar stools. The Jacuzzi and bar area are protected from the sun by a hard top.

• Bilge and Fuel Transfer Pneumatic Valve System

All bilge valves are DC Electric/Pneumatic and can be controlled by any SiMon Station (when enabled). All fuel transfer valves are DC Electric/Pneumatic and can be controlled by any SiMon Station (when enabled).

Fuel Service System
Bulkhead mounted fuel tank to gravity feed fuel to all machinery. Fuel is transferred from large aft tanks (with the added crossover valves opened, this equates to one large tank, accounting for half of the total capacity) to the gravity tank by the Alfa Laval (fuel purifier). The gravity tank overflows back to the large aft tanks, thus constantly keeping the gravity tank full to supply fuel to all machinery. This constant fuel exchange between tanks through the Alfa Laval makes the fuel very pure and clean. The Alfa Laval has a sump pump and tank which operates automatically to collect all sludge. There are another two (2) back up fuel pumps piped for the same purpose. The emergency generator, located on the sun deck, is also piped to the pumps and the Alfa Laval.

BROKER COMMENTS
SOVEREIGN is an extraordinary yacht that was built to rival the quality and capability of the Northern European pedigree shipyards. She was built by an experienced yachtsman who made sure the build included every opportunity to be successful by providing the finest supervision, engineering, design, time and quality material available. Time of build was of no concern and quality was the number one priority. The owner spared no cost in getting the vessel perfect before putting her in operation. Her second and present owner has been the perfect custodian offering SOVEREIGN the “state of the art” upgrades, annual surveys both maintenance and class, providing the vessel with whatever was needed. A listing of the upgrades is found further in the listing spec.

SOVEREIGN offers six large staterooms with two true masters. She offers volume not seen on a 55m with additional attributes to include 1,100 GRT, elevator, beach club, high ceilings, huge exterior deck space, four fin Quantum zero stabilization and much much more. A must see. You will not be disappointed.

EXCLUSIONS
A full exclusions list will be provided at the time of contract.

dealerListings.description:
MS. MONICA is a proven blue water vessel that was built for comfort and long range cruising. The full-time crew have maintained MS. MONICA to the highest standards. Cruise speeds in the upper teens make running from weather easy and hull-down operation increases efficiency for great range. Spacious living areas that encompass clever interior design allows access to the master stateroom from the salon staircase or through a door from the master walk-in closet to the forward guest stateroom hallway. All three staterooms have ensuite heads, A/V systems, and plenty of storage and hanging space. The crew quarters are quite large and can sleep four. Another unique feature MS. MONICA has to offer is a 2,200lb davit on the bridge deck, able to move and carry an 18' Novurania with a Yamaha F115 motor. When the tender is launched, the bridge deck becomes a huge entertainment or lounging area, in keeping with the other areas aboard which feel larger than most vessels in her size range.

MS. MONICA is in pristine condition and well-maintained, she is exactly what our current market wants. Loads of custom features set this elegant and comfortable yacht apart from the rest of the market, especially in this size range. Please call for more details.

descriptions.title: Detailed Information
descriptions.description:
Overview
MS. MONICA is a proven blue water vessel that was built for comfort and long range cruising. The full-time crew have maintained MS. MONICA to the highest standards. Cruise speeds in the upper teens make running from weather easy and hull-down operation increases efficiency for great range. Spacious living areas that encompass clever interior design allows access to the master stateroom from the salon staircase or through a door from the master walk-in closet to the forward guest stateroom hallway. All three staterooms have ensuite heads, A/V systems, and plenty of storage and hanging space. The crew quarters are quite large and can sleep four. Another unique feature MS. MONICA has to offer is a 2,200lb davit on the bridge deck, able to move and carry an 18' Novurania with a Yamaha F115 motor. When the tender is launched, the bridge deck becomes a huge entertainment or lounging area, in keeping with the other areas aboard which feel larger than most vessels in her size range.

MS. MONICA is in pristine condition and well-maintained, she is exactly what our current market wants. Loads of custom features set this elegant and comfortable yacht apart from the rest of the market, especially in this size range. Please call for more details.

Main Salon
Large windows surround the salon. The covered side decks provide shade but still allow a tremendous amount of natural light to fill this room. It is open to the galley, separated by a breakfast bar with 3 stools on the forward end and double doors open to the aft deck. Seating is abundant on a large, sectional sofa and 2 chairs. The TV is housed in a cabinet on the starboard side. A stairway on the forward, starboard side leads down to a lower foyer leading to a day head, engine room and aft entrance to the master stateroom.

• Custom sectional sofa with storage
• 2 x Chairs
• TV console
• LED lighting
• Carpeted sole
• Storage cabinets
• AV equipment housed forward of TV

Master Stateroom
The full-beam master stateroom has a large, walk-around, centerline berth with lots of natural light from 4 portlights. This warm space, loaded with semigloss cherry walls and cabinetry, may be entered by way of the lower foyer at the base of the salon stairway or through a hidden door which connects the master walk-in closet to the forward hallway to the guest staterooms. The master head has his and her sinks, as well as a toilet and shower.

• Mid-ship location for least movement and quietest location aboard
• Master berth with drawers beneath and upholstered headboard
• Bedside tables with granite tops and storage
• Reading lights on both sides
• Walk-in closet
• 4 x Opening port lights
• Soji screens over portlights
• Carpeted sole
• Private entrance
• Easy access to engine room and switch panel
• TV
• Sonos sound bar

Lower Foyer
This clever, custom feature allows private access to the master stateroom, forward access to the engine room and easy access to a day head from the salon. This head also may function as a second head for the master stateroom.

Lower Guest Stateroom Hallway
• Carpeted sole
• Linen closet
• Miele front-load washer and dryer
• VIP stateroom
• Guest stateroom

VIP Stateroom
The comfortable VIP Stateroom is located in the forepeak and is accessed from the pilothouse stairway. Natural light keeps this area light and bright.

• Centerline queen-sized berth
• 2 x Hanging lockers
• Storage drawers
• 2 x Opening port-lights
• Overhead hatch
• Reading lights
• Carpeted sole
• Ensuite head

Guest Stateroom
The Guest Stateroom is located on the port side, forward of the master stateroom. The side-by-side berths are large and comfortable.

• 2 x Berths with bedside table between
• Reading lights
• Opening port light
• Hanging locker
• Storage drawers
• Carpeted sole
• Ensuite head

Crew Quarters
The main entrance to the crew quarters is through a watertight door in the transom. A roomy crew lounge has been customized to include a fold-down pullman berth in addition to a larger berth utilized by dropping the dinette table. A small galley is adjacent to the dinette. Aft of the galley is a large area with hanging space for clothes or dive gear, as well as 2 SubZero freezer drawers and a 2nd washer and dryer set. On the starboard side are the full crew head and a captain’s room with a large, double berth and loads of storage cabinets. The engine room may be accessed from this area as well.

• Accommodations for 4 crew
• Full head
• Crew dinette
• Crew galley
• Freezer drawers
• Bosch washer and dryer
• Under-counter refrigeration and freezer
• Sink and faucet
• Engine room access

Galley
Forward of the salon is 3 stools facing a breakfast bar and share a counter with the large, U-shaped galley on the port side. Another counter against the starboard side covers a dual-zone wine refrigerator, cocktail refrigerator and ice maker. This differs from other 80's, which have a day head here rather than down the stairs. The galley is separated from the pilothouse, allowing for proper night-running with low light at the helm.

• GE Profile ceramic cooktop
• GE Profile convection oven
• GE Profile convection microwave
• Miele dishwasher
• KithchenAid trash compactor
• Jenn-air refrigerator/freezer
• Stainless steel sink
• Disposal
• Insta-Hot water
• Quartz counters
• SubZero dual zone wine refrigerator
• U-Line refrigerator
• U-Line ice maker
• Teak and holly sole

Pilothouse
The large pilothouse is separated from the galley by a bulkhead and door. An elevated, U-shaped seating area with dining table aft of the helm has great views. Twin Stidd chairs are positioned within easy reach of the controls and electronics. Sightlines are great and doors to port and starboard side decks are mere steps away. On the port side of the pilothouse, stairs lead up to the flybridge and another set of stairs lead down to staterooms.

Flybridge
The enormous Flybridge is accessed from the staircase on the aft deck or the staircase from the Pilothouse. The upper helm is forward on the centerline with full controls and instrumentation and 2 Stidd chairs. A 3-sided enclosure is attached to the hardtop, which covers the port and starboard seating as well as the helm area. Aft of that area are large, molded-in consoles to port and starboard housing a stainless steel gas grill, sink and Eskimo ice chipper with an insulated ice bin sectioned for long-term vegetable storage too. Aft of that area is a 2,200 lb davit for lifting the 18’ Novurania 550DL with Yamaha F115.

• ACR Globalfix 406/GPIRB CAT 1 satellite EPIRB w/autorelease mounted on boat deck
• KVH Tracphone 252 Inmarsat worldwide coverage SAT phone connected to phone system
• KVH Tracvision G6 24" SAT TV tracking system
• 2 x Furuno 15" color displays-1 computer; 1 Furuno Navnet
• Nauticomp 3 button, weather-proof mouse panel mount
• Furuno FM 3000 VHF
• 2 x Raymarine ST 50 Depth Systems w/tranducers fore and aft
• Simrad AP 25; full 2nd station autopilot control
• Simrad R3000X handheld remote for autopilot
• Simrad FU 25 follow up steering lever
• 2 x Stidd helm chairs
• 2 x L-shaped seating benches with storage
• Eskimo ice chipper with insulated chest for ice storage and split for long term vegetable storage
• Stainless Steel gas bbq
• Sink and faucet
• Cabinet storage
• 2,200 lb Davit
• 18’ Novurania 550DL with Yamaha F115
• Hardtop with 3 sided enclosure

Aft Deck
The large aft deck is centered by a table which easily seats 6+ guests. A bench runs across the middle, aft section and 4 chairs surround the sides and forward side. Doors protect access to the stairs to the swim platform and the bulwarks port and starboard contain doors as well. Also, the covered side decks have canvas wing doors and a stairway leads to the flybridge. Double doors open to the salon and the beautiful teak sole has a full Sunbrella cover.

• Easy access from every side
• LED overhead lighting
• Storage inside aft bench
• Teak table with cover
• Teak sole with cover
• Bosun’s locker
• Removable shade protects the aft bench and swim platform
Swim Platform
Curved, protected stairs to port and starboard lead to the swim platform from the aft deck and removable hoop rails run along the aft edge.
• Teak stairs and platform
• 2 x 50 amp service, one on Cablemaster
• Tow cleats with backing plates
• Freshwater shower
• Shore water connection
• Dive compressor air outlet
• Water-tight transom door to crew quarters

Hull
• Hand laid-up FRP hull w/PVC core sandwich construction above waterline and vinylester lamination for osmosis protection
• Full-length longitudinal engine stringers and athwartship stringers
• Windows with 3/8 in. tempered glass in salon, 1/2 in. tempered glass in pilothouse
• Rub rails with stainless steel capping
• Built-in swim platform with stainless steel swim ladder and removable U-Rails.
• Quiet-Roll integrated spray rail system

Exterior Equipment
• Quiet Roll integrated spray rail system
• 2 x Maxwell VWC4000 hydraulic windlass & dual anchor rollers w/handheld remote
• 105 lb. CQR type plow anchor w/400 ft. 1/2" HT chain
• 105 lb. Bruce design SS anchor w/400 ft. 1/2" HT chain
• 2 x Chain counter for windlass
• Cablemaster forward w/90' of cable
• Cablemaster aft w/90' of cable
• 2 x Shore power inlets w/rotary select switches (fore & aft), shore water inlet and TV/Tel inlet on foredeck
• Teak deck around pilothouse, side decks, aft deck and swim platform
• SS spiral stairs from aft deck to boat deck
• Storage lockers on foredeck
• 2200 lb. hydraulic davit
• Textiline sunscreens on all pilothouse windows

Communication and Navigation
• CAT electronic LED displays
• Glendinning electronic, single lever controls for gears/throttles
• 3 x ViewEra flat panel monitors
• PC-Based system with Nobletech
• Wireless keyboard and mouse
• Simrad AP 25 Autopilot
• Simrad FU 25 jog stick
• 2 x Furuno NavNet control heads
• Furuno 72 nm, 12 kw Navnet radar w/6 ft. antenna array
• Furuno ARP target plotter
• Furuno 48 nm, 4 kw Navnet radar w/3.5 ft. antenna array for close in contacts
• 2 x Furuno GP 1920C Navnet for C-map charts
• Furuno 600w/1kw sounder
• Furuno FA-150 Universal AIS
• 2 x Furuno GP-33 GPS
• 2 x Furuno FM-3000 VHF
• 2 x ACR Spotlight controls
• VGA to NTSC converter converts computer video to television video so Furuno info is available in staterooms
• Furuno 600w/1 kw Sounder
• Simrad AP 25 Autopilot
• Simrad FU 25 Followup steering lever
• Simard R3000X hand-held remote for autopilot
• 4 x Camera system for engine room and aft deck w/pilothouse controller connected to Navnet systems
• Xantrex Prosine 1000w 24v DC inverter for computer and screens
• Raymarine ST 60 Speed System
• Raymarine ST 60 Wind Speed and Direction Systems
• 2 x Raymarine ST 60 Depth Systems (2 transducers, both fore and aft)
• GSM fixmount cell phone connected to Panasonic phone system
• Brother fax, scanner, printer and copy machine under pilothouse console
• GEOSAT EC-01 High Gain WiFi Booster
• 3 x Wireless Access (3 com access points located throughout vessel
• ABT Digital Stabilizer led control screen 7.5 sq. ft. fins
• ABT Bow and stern thrusters
• Windshield wiper and freshwater washer controls
• Garmin GPSmap 7610

Main Machinery
The engine room is entered from the crew quarters or the lower foyer from the salon. It is clean and bright with plenty of room to service equipment.

• Twin Caterpillar C32 engines (1550 hp ea.) w/ZF transmissions and instruments for dual stations
• Aqua drive units
• Glendinning engine controls for pilothouse and flybridge and remote control unit with 3 plug-ins (aft deck, Portuguese bridge, and center of flybridge)
• ABT Trac hydraulic bow thruster, stern thruster, 38hp each
• ABT Trac hydraulic stabilizers w/7.5 sq.ft. fins
• Underwater blanketed ceramic exhaust system w/bypass and FRP mufflers
• SS propeller shafts w/4-blade Nibral propellers.
• Tides packless shaft seals
• Second dripless shaft bearing
• SS struts w/bearings
• SS rudders w/bearings
• 2 x Racor 75/1000 max dual fuel filters on main engines
• 2 x Racor 75/1000 max single fuel filters for generators
• Racor 75/1000 max dual filter for fuel polishing through transfer pump & day tank
• Algae X fuel polishing system
• Oil change pump for engines and generators
• Chilled water A/C system
• Max Q Model RO Watermaker 1800/gpd
• Water purification system w/softener for washdowns and house use
• Prop Speed paint on props, shafts & struts
• 4 x Automatic 24v DC and 1 Engine driven bilge pumps
• 2 x 220v AC 20 gal. water heaters w/heat exchangers

Electrical Equipment
• 2 x Northern Lights 25kw (60hz) generators w/sound shields
• Electric distribution panel w/gauges and circuit breakers for 230/115v AC and 24/12v DC system
• 2 x 50 AMP Shore power inlets (fore and aft w/automatic shut off)
• 2 x 15 KVA Isolation transformers
• 2 x Engine banks w/2 AGM 8DL-255 AH batteries for each bank
• 2 x House banks w/2 AGM 8DL-255 AH batteries for each bank
• 2 x Generator banks w/one (1) AGM 3IT-105AH battery each
• 1 x 60 AMP (24v) and 1 x 20AMP (12v) battery chargers
• Cantalupi 155 series 24v overhead halogen light fixtures throughout
• 24v DC rope style valance lights in salon and staterooms
• 24v DC step lights and automatic wardrobe lights
• 2 x 115v AC and 2 x 24v DC engine room blowers
• 3 x Exalto dual speed self-parking windshield wipers w/washdown system
• One Kahlenburg D-2 dual trumpet air horn w/compressor
• 2 x Danforth 5" magnetic compass
• DC-DC Converter (24v to 12v)
• 2 x Shaft brushes in engine room
• Nutone Central vacuum system w/outlets in staterooms and salon/galley
• Copper bonding system to all underwater fittings w/zinc anodes
• 24v Forward bilge ventilation
• Air compressor for horns, tools and fenders

Broker Comments
Ms. Monica is the perfect yacht for any destination of choice due to her shallow draft at only 5.6”. She has been upgraded for dependability and is safe for extended periods of cruising in any waters. Previous owners and crew took exceptional care of her to the point she represents herself as a newer model vessel than she is. Ms. Monica warrants an inspection as one will not be disappointed in this vessel. She is ready to cruise at a minutes notice!

Exclusions
Owner's personal effects and artwork. A full inventory of exclusions to be provided at time of fully executed purchase agreement.

LADY MIKKI has just finished her refit at the Bugari Shipyard. Full list of upgrades available upon request. LADY MIKKI represents a great opportunity to buy a true Bluewater cruiser with proven sea-keeping abilities.

descriptions.title: Refit 2019
descriptions.description:
Refit 2019
• Tank tops have been sandblasted throughout, primed and repainted with international paint system.
• Lazzerette has been sandblasted, primed and repainted with international paint system.
• A new custom tender launch system has been installed which is operated hydraulically to fit a 5.10m tender inside.
• Main exhaust system has been taken out, reconditioned and re installed with new insulation material.
• All sea valves have been taken out, serviced and reinstalled.
• Transom rubbing strake has been taken off, refinished and welded back on again.
• New customs transom name plate has been installed with LED lighting.
• Water tanks have been opened and coatings applied.
• Both 28kva panda/kubota generators have had an overhaul.
• Both main engines caterpillar 420bhp have been serviced.
• New box was fitted around A/C chillers in engine room.
• Bilge pumps have been taken out, serviced and reinstalled.
• All fan coils have been serviced and 3 have been replaced completely.
• New sounder installed in Cofferdam for new bridge systems.
• Chain-locker has been completely stripped, sandblasted and repainted with international paint system.
• Salon has been completely redesigned to a more sensible lay out with 1 U-shaped sofa and 2 separate armchairs opposite to create more space. A new carpet has also been fitted in parts of the salon.
• New upholstery for most ceiling panels and wall panels throughout the yacht.
• New staircase railings have been fitted with LED lights from main deck to guest cabins and to the bridge.
• New television has been installed in guest VIP cabin with apple TV.
• 1 x Crew cabin has been taken out to enlarge the galley. The galley now includes a large cooking isle, all new appliances including wine fridges and completely new woodwork throughout.
• Bridge has been completely upgraded with new GPS, chart plotter, autopilot, bow thruster controls, GPS compass, echosounder, joystick controls. All equipment has also been installed on fly bridge station.
• New Stidd pilot chair has been installed on the bridge.
• Cap rail has been repaired and varnished.
• Door has been added in cockpit bar area for extra storage.
• Stern main deck covers have been custom made that can completely enclose the stern.

dealerListings.description: NINA LU is the newest 40m Westport available on the market. She is found in excellent condition as she has had incredible care her entire life. Her present owner has done a tremendous number of quality improvements and upgrades that will prove current for years to come. She is ABS and MCA compliant. We welcome your inspection of this gorgeous 40 meter Westport, currently located in Fort Lauderdale, FL. You will not be disappointed!

descriptions.title: Detailed Information
descriptions.description:
OVERVIEW
NINA LU, a 2011 Westport 40m hull # 4 is found in excellent condition with many recent upgrades., NINA LU has had only three owners, all keeping her to the highest yacht standards. Her present ownership just completed her a refit to update the décor to a modern look and her nav and AV to today’s standards. She is ABS and MCA compliant.

Boarding NINA LU on the aft deck one will walk through a set of automatic doors to enter her main salon, where one will be received by a warm, open and comfortable seating area. The salon offers a modern feel with four occasional chairs, coffee table and sofa along with an entertainment center with a pop up 60" HDTV 4K with surround sound all controlled by Crestron. The dining area is forward of the main salon and can seat up to ten guests with buffets to port and starboard. There is a door between the dining area and galley making for easy dining services. Forward of the dining area to starboard one will reach a formal foyer with access to the vessel through side boarding. Here one will find a day bathroom. To port of dinning one will enter a state-of-the-art galley with ample fringe/freezes counter space and with the best of cooking galley operation appliances

NINA LU on-deck master suite is forward of the main foyer with entry through the owner’s study into the master cabin with king bed, bath with double sinks, large shower, toilet and bidet. There is a vanity to port, a walk-in closet forward and ample storage throughout. The entertainment center has a 50” HDTV 4K, with full entertainment and surround sound. Going back to the foyer one will find a stairway that goes up to the skylounge and pilothouse or down to the guest accommodations. Going down one will land in the guest foyer where four guest cabins are found. The first VIP stateroom is located aft on the lower deck to port with a centerline king- sized bed with two nightstands, dresser, closet, private bathroom and shower, plus an entertainment center with LG 37” 4K with full entertainment. The second VIP stateroom is located to starboard aft on the lower deck and has a centerline king-sized bed with two nightstands, dresser, closet, private bathroom and shower, plus an entertainment center with LG 37” 4K.
One of the twin cabins is located to starboard with the third berth located outboard and above the twin berth. The 4th guest stateroom found to port forward is twin cabin is to port with two berths. Both twin guest cabins have a dresser, closet, private bathroom and shower plus an entertainment center with LG 32” 4K.

NINA LU’s sky lounge is a favorite gathering area with spacious seating, a full bar with three stools, game table, relaxing L-Shape sofa, fireplace with and a Samsung 50” 4K above and full entertainment center with surround sound. From the skylounge one can go aft through an automatic door to the bridge deck aft where one will find covered seating, this area also gives you access to the main deck aft below and the sundeck above. In addition, going forward one will pass by a day head on route to the pilothouse where one will find all the communication and nav equipment one could need.

NINA LU’s sundeck is found by going up the stairs from the bridge deck aft. Reaching the sundeck, one will find a U- Shape seating area with tables prefect area for lounging. Also located on the sundeck is a dining table for eight with protection from weather or sun with sun awnings. There is a gorgeous bar with four stools, BBQ and fridge and a Jacuzzi forward of the bar with surround sun pads able to accommodate many guests There is full entertainment with a 52” Sunview.

NINA LU’ s aft deck makes for an excellent gathering space with 42" Sunview HDTV situated above the full bar with three stools. Additional seating on a custom U-Shape settee with two teak adjustable tables. From the aft deck one has easy access to the water, tender and water sports. Her walk-around teak decks lead to the bow, which four loungers and further forward on the bow one will find an additional seating area.

MAIN SALON
The main salon is an expansive and elegant area. The 50” TV rises out of the aft corner cabinet. The aft entry door is stainless steel framed, glass, open/close sliding mechanism with pneumatic seal. Featuring designer flooring and wall coverings, one sofa, cocktail table, three occasional chairs, three end tables and game table with four chairs.

The day head is located off the starboard entry foyer and features a stone top vanity, vessel sink, toilet, stone flooring and coordinated bath accessories.

• Samsung 55” 4K TV
• Surround sound receiver/speaker and sub-woofer
• Direct TV satellite receiver
• Samsung Blu-Ray player and USB
• Crestron iPad control
• Kaleidescape movie/music player

DINING AREA
Forward of the main salon is the formal dining area. Servers have easy access from the galley via a dual-hinged access door. The formal dining table, made of Pommele Sapele wood with Mahogany accents, seats ten guests. There is buffet storage to port, starboard and aft, with storage for sixteen 5-piece place settings of china, flatware, stemware and A/V units.

GALLEY AND LAUNDRY EQUIPMENT
• Northland 30” reach-in refrigerator
• Northland 18” reach-in freezer
• Built-in standard oven by Gaggeneau
• Built-in convection/steamer oven by Gaggeneau
• APW Wyott countertop finishing oven
• Five-burner Cook Tek Induction Cook Top
• Panasonic 1000 watt programmable microwave
• Fisher Pakel high temp double drawer dishwasher
• Perlick 48 bottle wine cooler
• Perlick ice maker
• Polished chrome hot water dispenser by Insinkerator
• Broan trash compactor
• Speakers built into the unit
• Direct TV satellite receiver
• Crestron iPad control
• Kaleidescape movie/movie player

MASTER STATEROOM
The spacious master stateroom features a king-sized berth with upholstered headboard, built-in dressers, an entertainment system and A/V equipment complemented by Crestron control, office area with desk, vanity table/desk and private his/her dressing rooms with ample storage, dresser, hanging space and designer accent lighting. Additional master stateroom features include:

• Nightstands
• Vanity table/desk and chair
• Lighted makeup mirror
• Master office – desk and chair
• Samsung 50” 4K TV
• Surround sound receiver/speaker and sub-woofer (plus speakers in master head)
• Direct TV satellite receiver

MASTER HEAD
• Vanity with stone countertop
• Dual china sinks
• Fixtures and bath accessories
• Designer marble flooring
• Mirrors over vanities in his/her heads
• Lighted wall-mounted makeup mirror
• Headhunter Royal Flush Hydro-Vac toilet

• Shower with frameless tempered glass door and marble surround

VIP GUEST STATEROOM - PORT
• King sized berth
• Upholstered headboard
• Nightstands with drawers in the base
• LG 37” 4K TV
• Pair of speakers
• Direct TV satellite receiver
• Samsung Blu-Ray player and USB

CREW QUARTERS
The captain’s cabin with private head accommodates two persons. Crew quarters with two heads accommodate four in two cabins. There is immediate crew access to the galley via the direct galley/crew quarters stairway. The fourth crew cabin (engineer’s cabin) is located aft of the engine room with private bath. Each room has a TV and Crestron iPad control.

Crew Galley/Lounge

SKYLOUNGE

PILOTHOUSE

The high-quality joinery work established throughout the vessel is also evident in the pilothouse dashboard, with its extensive array of navigational equipment. Other features include:

Telephone System

Cordless phones are located in the master stateroom, skylounge, pilothouse, and 2 in the salon (1 intended for the Aft Deck). EXTERIOR DECKS
The exterior decks on NINA LU provide a variety of ideal lounge and entertainment spaces. The Aft Main Deck area allows for covered alfresco dining while providing a settee seating area and an outdoor bar with a drop-down TV for entertaining. The Aft Bridge Deck provides an area for lounging in the sun and has a BBQ grill and drop-down TV.

Forward of the Bridge Deck is more deck space for enjoying the sun on chaise lounges. The Sun Deck has a large hard top with water misters which allows guests to enjoy the Jacuzzi surrounded by sun pads in the sun or under some shade while enjoying a magnificent breeze. Dining alfresco on the Sun Deck is also an option for enjoying the beautiful sunsets at dinner.

SAFETY, SECURITY AND FIRE FIGHTING EQUIPMENT
Cameras

• Monitoring station: with display on BSS

Signals and Lights
• Ship’s whistle

• Air powered horn: Kahlenberg F-2 five trumpets
• Kahlenberg M511-A signal timer
• Full array of running lights
• Carlisle & Finch 200-watt xenon, 15 million candlepower, remote controlled search light

Firefighting Equipment
The interior of the vessel is protected by sprinklers which draw from the ship’s fresh water supply. In the event the water supply is depleted the system will revert to seawater use without interruption. Engine room is protected by gas smothering FM200 system. Water delivery is by two pumps, operating individually or in tandem, depending upon demand. A small pressure tank maintains the stand-by pressure in the system. Control panels are in the engine room with a mimic display in the pilothouse.

• There are four fire stations and three pumps (the main AC pump, a back-up diesel pump which is fixed, not portable, and the third is the AC bilge pump which can be switched over to run as a fire pump.) Each station contains a hose, angle valve and high/low volume nozzle. The primary electric fire pump can be started from any fire station or locally.
• Hoses: (7) 1 ½ “x 50’ FM listed, lay flat type
• ABS approved fire nozzles: (1) at each of the four hydrant stations
• Pump, primary: centrifugal, flooded suction, 66gpm@40psi
• Pump, back-up: diesel powered portable, flooded suction centrifugal
• Strainer: sea suction strainer for fire/bilge manifold, bronze 2” Y strainer
• Seawater intake: bronze with stainless steel grate
• Hose rack: fiberglass construction with rolled hose storage in fire station
• Galley Hood Fire System: independent, fixed system is located in the main galley in the hood above the stove
• Fire extinguishers: dry chemical (9) ten lb., (9) five lb., (1) three lb. (1) ten lb. Carbon Dioxide

Safety Equipment
• Equipment required for charter service under Cayman Islands Shipping Registry and MCA compliancy for up to 12 passengers.
• Life Raft: (4) ten-man Solas approved life rafts mounted on Boat Deck rails
• (23) Coast Guard approved adult life preservers w/water lights
• (6) Coast Guard approved child life preservers w/water lights
• (4) 30” diameter ring buoys

BROKER COMMENTS
NINA LU is the newest 40m Westport available on the market. She is found in excellent condition as she has had incredible care her entire life. Her present owner has done a tremendous number of quality improvements and upgrades that will prove current for years to come. We welcome your inspection of this gorgeous 40 meter Westport, you will not be disappointed!

descriptions.title: Overview
descriptions.description:
The Sea Ray 50 Sundancer, which was renamed 52, is perhaps the most comfortable rough-weather model built by this manufacturer. Below, she has a very large, open salon and galley area with plenty of natural light. Forward are two staterooms and two heads. The helm deck and cockpit offer an enormous area for entertaining. Executive Function has the preferred blue hull, hydraulic boat lift and upgraded electronics. Her exterior and interior are in great shape. This is a very clean Sea Ray 500 Sundancer which has been regularly used and cared-for.

Key Features:

  • Hydraulic dinghy lift
  • Air conditioned helm deck
  • Navy blue hull
  • Cummins QSM-11 main engines serviced in August of 2020
  • Updated electronics

descriptions.title: Walkthrough
descriptions.description:
Boarding from most floating docks Is an easy transition to the hydraulic tender platform. The transom of the boat is easily accessible from the molded swim platform forward of the lift. A door on the transom flips open to expose a large storage area containing lift control and Glendinning Cablemaster for the 50-amp power cord. A solid door on the port side leads to the large, aft deck. Seating wraps from the door across the back end and forward on the starboard side. Forward of the transom door on the starboard side is a built-in bar with refrigeration behind cabinet doors.

The helm is up two steps, providing excellent sight lines. More guest seating is directly inboard of the captain’s seat. This area is air-conditioned and has a cockpit cover. On the starboard side is the door leading below. The 50 has a very large, open living area with plenty of natural light from portlights and a deck light. The second sofa, along the port side, conceals a hide-a-bed. The galley is open to the salon and has plenty of refrigerated space and storage. To starboard is the guest stateroom. It has oversized bunks above and below, each with a TV. The guest head may be accessed from the galley area or from the guest stateroom. Forward is the master stateroom, featuring a very large, island berth. The master head is accessed privately.

Every room in this vessel has natural light, making her feel even larger in volume.

descriptions.title: Accommodations
descriptions.description:
Onto from the swim platform you can enter the port or starboard cockpit through stainless steel boarding gates that lift and swing into a locked position. Along the transom is an aft truck where lines are stored, and cables connected. The transom has a large storage area or fish box. Forward of the transom is a fold up or down forward-facing bench seat.

The cockpit is large with plenty of room. There are port and starboard molded steps onto the side decks. The side decks are wide and offers plenty of hand holds to make maneuverability a breeze. The bow deck has a removable sun cushion with stainless steel rails and built in cup holders. Access to the anchor and windlass are safe and easy.

Back to the cockpit along the port side is a wet bar with sink and plenty of storage. There is a U-Line refrigerator in the cabinet below the sink. Across from the wet bar on the starboard side is the bait prep area complete with cutting board, storage, sink with spray faucet and a trash receptacle. Along the starboard side is a recessed storage area for fishing rods, boat hook, or the like. Built into the gunnels along the port side is a storage area for fishing lures. Either way, you can use these fishing spaces for fishing supplies or use them for storage while cruising.

The entire cockpit sole will lift with an electric ram revealing the engine compartment. There is plenty of space in the compartment for maintenance and fluid checks. The generator is aft along the starboard side of the compartment. Batteries are within easy reach as well.

The helm area features double helm seating with bolsters and across from the helm seat is a single companion seat also with bolster. The helm offers an excellent panoramic view of the surroundings and all instrumentation and gauges are within easy reach. There is an opening vent in the middle windshield. The helm is covered with a three-side Sunbrella blue enclosure and the cockpit area has a slanted cover as well.

You enter the cabin spaces through a sliding door from the helm. Down four steps into the main cabin the cabin spaces are large and offer lots of natural lighting. Immediately aft of the steps is the L-Shaped aft cabin settee which may be converted into a berth. There are storage cabinets port and starboard and a privacy curtain separates the cabin. To port of the steps is the head compartment with a large molded fiberglass vanity and sink, mirrored cabinet doors above and a cabinet under the sink. The shower space is large, and the head is a Vacu-Flush head.

In the main cabin the galley is located along the port side and offers excellent food storage and preparation areas. Across from the galley is the salon settee which can convert into a berth, high/low dining table and ample storage cabinets and shelves. Aft of the salon is the TV mounted on the bulkhead.

All the way forward is the stateroom. Along the port side is a cabinet with shelf storage and along the starboard side is a hanging locker with a small settee. The berth is centerline and with storage drawers under the foot of the berth. Along the port and starboard sides of the cabin are storage cabinets and shelving. There is an overhead hatch with an Ocean Air sliding screen and sun blocking shade.

A nice layout and ready to go!

descriptions.title: Galley
descriptions.description:
Located in the main cabin along the port side, the galley offers excellent food preparation and storage capabilities that will please even the most discriminating chef.

  • Molded fiberglass countertops with granite colored gel coat, matching sink cover
  • Molded sink with stainless steel faucet
  • Stainless steel hand rail just below the countertop
  • LG stainless steel combination microwave and coffeemaker
  • Euro-Kera Kenyon recessed (2) burner electric stove top with matching cover
  • Ample storage cabinets and shelf above the countertop with plate storage area
  • Ample storage and drawers below the countertop with cutlery insert
  • Dual voltage galley lighting: 12-volt and 120-volt
  • Coolmatic dual voltage refrigerator with freezer
  • U-Line dual voltage refrigerator and freezer in cockpit wet bar area
  • Power ventilation, 12-volt

descriptions.title: Electrical
descriptions.description:
The main distribution panel is in a cabinet along the starboard side between the main and aft cabin.There is an additional engine DC panel in the engine compartment.

dealerListings.description:
43 Ft. Beneteau 2011

PRICE REDUCTION OF $25,000!

A beautiful three stateroom and three head sailboat was used in charter in the Caribbean for a number of years. Returned after charter to the fastidious owner who subsequently updated her for the re-sale market. With many new updates to meet today’s standards "TERANGA" is ready to continue her adventures in comfort and style. A perfect cruising or live aboard boat with large cabins and storage capability.

Exterior varnish just re-done and all new interior upholstery!! Shows great!!

contact.name: United Yacht Sales - South Carolina / North Carolina Area

address.street: Serving Charleston SC and North Carolina

dealerListings.title: Priced to sell!

descriptions.title: Accommodations
descriptions.description:
The three stateroom and three head layout gives the boat plenty of room for owner and guests. The interior features beautiful wood work, teak and holly flooring, overhead hatches, skylights, opening ports and new seating upholstery and mattress covers.

As you approach the Beneteau 43 she feels much larger with beautiful design lines and feel of elegance. Boarding through either the port or starboard boarding gate you step onto the wide side decks making fore and aft maneuverability a breeze. Heading forward there is an anchor locker and plenty of room to sit and relax on the bow. Head aft into the cockpit. The cockpit can seat a crowd on the teak inlay seats and the cockpit is protected with a blue Sunbrella bimini and dodger. There are dual helms with leather wrapped steering wheels and a centered cockpit table with port and starboard folding leaves. Aft, the helm seat swivels allowing access to the stern swim platform where you will find a stainless steel swim ladder as well. There is a hot and cold water transom shower.

Through louvered doors and down a few steps you enter the main cabin. Immediately aft on the port and starboard sides is access into the aft cabins with double berths, hanging lockers and en-suite heads. The heads have a vanity with sink, manual toilets and shower. The navigation station is forward on the starboard side with access to the electrical panel. The navigation table top lifts up for added storage. Along the port side is the galley area with top loading refer and freezer, double sinks, and stove top and oven. The galley is large with plenty of food preparation and storage. Across from the galley on the starboard side are the dinette and salon settees. The L-Shaped settee, which can convert to an additional berth, offers plenty of seating plus there is a bench seat for two inboard and an additional bench seat for one facing forward. All the way forward is another cabin with a V-Berth, plenty of storage and an en-suite head with vanity and sink, manual toilet, and shower.

descriptions.description:
Located in the main cabin along the port side, the galley is large with plenty of room for food preparation and storage space that will please even the most discriminating chef.

dealerListings.description:
Contemporary Hatteras motoryacht raised the bar for luxury in the late 1990s. The four stateroom interior boats enormous owner's suite with his and her heads, two full featured VIP staterooms, a third stateroom with bunks, full width salon with formal dining area, and  protected decks.  Reverse transom design allows for an "activity platform" in place of a cockpit.  The walk-in engine room is large and offers excellent maintenance room.  The Detroit Diesel 1,100 hp engines will cruise at 18 knots.

The fastidious owner has owned THAT’S A WRAP since 2004 and has consistently maintained and upgrades her over the years, spending summers in MD and winters in Key West.  She is ready for new adventures with new bottom paint, waxed hull and topsides and up-to-date maintenance.

contact.name: United Yacht Sales - South Carolina / North Carolina Area

address.street: Serving Charleston SC and North Carolina

dealerListings.title: New arrival

descriptions.title: Vessel Walkthrough
descriptions.description:
Boarding the vessel is easy from either the port or starboard side, mid-ship at pilothouse sliding doors. The 3 guest cabins are forward which include two VIP Staterooms with queen size beds, cedar-lined closets, and en-suite heads. The additional guest stateroom has bunk beds and a en-suite bathroom.

The galley and salon are just aft of the pilot house. There is a U-shaped dinette with seating for six across from galley.  The galley has granite counter tops and is open to the roomy salon with large windows on both port and starboard side. The large windows and open galley create an open, free flowing feel to salon.

The private master stateroom and engine room is accessed in the salon through stair case on starboard side. The master all the way aft is full beam with a King size bed with walk-in cedar closets, vanity, entertainment center, and his & her bathrooms. The engine room is just forward of master stateroom.

The flybridge is accessed from pilothouse staircase. The flybridge features an extended hardtop that shades all of the seating. The huge island bar in middle has a sink, refrigerator and three comfortable bar stools.  There are 2 helm seats at the helm with ample electronics.

As you enter the lower staterooms from the pilothouse, at the foot of the steps and to starboard Is the laundry center with stacked GE separate washer and dryer.  Access into the generator room is through a hatch in the companionway.

Forward Deck:  Access by way of either pilot house doors.  Wide and safe side decks offers ease of movement.  The deck has built-in seating facing forward and a large sun cushion on the cabin top.  The windlass is easy to use and the large foredeck makes anchoring a breeze.

Flybridge:  Access to the bridge is easy from the pilot house. The bridge access overhead hatch and door can be closed and locked.  The bridge is very large and has been customized.  The helm offers two helm chairs and excellent 360 degree visibility.  Aft of the helm is a centered cabinet with a wet bar and refrigerator/freezer and storage cabinet.  The aft section of the cabinet is rounded and there are three built-in sitting stools.  The aft bridge deck offers seating for a crowd with a U-shaped seating area with storage under the seats. Aft of the seating is storage for the inflatable RIB or other water toys.  A large davit will launch and recover the toys.  The bridge is protected by a hard top that extends from the helm to the aft section of the deck with esinglass protection along the helm front and sides.

Aft Deck: Up a few starboard side steps from the swim platform is the open Aft Deck.  The aft deck is a lovely entertaining or relaxation spot.  On deck are two wicker love seats and a low coffee table.  The area is protected with stainless steel rails and stanchions.  You enter the main salon through a door on the aft deck.  There are emergency controls hidden in a cabinet on the port side.

Swim Platform:  The extended platform gives ample room for seating or playing in the water.  There is a circular step along the starboard side leading up to the aft deck.  A swim ladder extends for easy boarding from the water.

descriptions.title: Galley / Dinette
descriptions.description:
The desired “up” galley is quite large and U-shaped.  The counters are granite surfaces with matching granite back splash.  Home type black finish, full size, appliances make food storage and preparation easy.  The galley offers excellent storage cabinetry and drawers.  Natural light and ventilation is excellent.  Both the galley and dinette have fabric valances and mini-blinds.  The galley will please even the most discriminating onboard chef.

The dinette area is across from the galley on the starboard side.  The dinette is C-shaped and has a high-low table made of granite that matches the galley countertops.   Under the settees is drawer storage.

  • Granite countertops with matching backsplash
  • Double stainless steel sinks with faucet and sprayer
  • In-Sink-Erator garbage disposal
  • Keurig coffee maker
  • Frigidaire 4-burner stove top
  • GE under the counter full size stove
  • GE Side by Side refrigerator and freezer
  • GE Quiet Power dishwasher
  • Fabreware full size microwave
  • Kold Front ice maker under the counter
  • Avanti wine cooler
  • U-Line refrigerator with ice maker in fly bridge
  • Single stainless steel sink on fly bridge with cold water faucet

descriptions.title: Pilothouse
descriptions.description: The pilot house has excellent seating with an elevated seat that allows a panoramic view and easy access to all gauges and instrumentation.  Under the seat are several drawers and cabinets for storage.  There are port and starboard pilot house doors leading to the bow deck and access to the fly bridge are along the starboard side and offer wide step treads for easy maneuvering.  In the pilot house there are port side cabinets which reveal the AC electrical panel and generator controls. Steps from the pilot house located on the starboard side offer access to the lower cabins.  DC electrical panel is in a cabinet outboard as you walk down the cabin steps.

descriptions.title: Master Stateroom
descriptions.description: Accessed down steps in the main salon the master is aft and private. The massive stateroom is unique and offers his and hers separate heads.  The berth is a king sized, center-lined berth with an upholstered head board and storage shelves.  Along the port side is a vanity and the built-in entertainment system.  To starboard is a large walk-in closet which is cedar-lined.  Along the port and starboard sides are large drawers and shelving.  Access to his and her heads is aft.  The head areas are separated by a shared shower and whirlpool tub with sliding glass doors.  The heads offer solid surface countertops, sliding mirror storage and vanity storage.  The heads are fresh water electric toilets.

descriptions.title: VIP and Guest Staterooms / Heads
descriptions.description:
Guest Staterooms:  As you enter the lower staterooms from the pilot house, at the foot of the steps and to starboard Is the laundry center with stacked GE separate washer and dryer.  Access into the generator room is through a hatch in the companionway.

VIP Forward Stateroom:  The forward guest stateroom features a center-lined queen berth with a mirrored headboard which opens to the anchor locker.  Overhead is a large hatch for light and ventilation.  Outboard are port and starboard matching shelves with aft drawers.  Along the starboard side is a cedar-lined hanging locker.  To port and mounted on the bulkhead is a flat screen television.  Along the aft bulkheads are port and starboard storage cabinets.  There are two opening ports with screens.  At the top of the steps is a private entry into the shared head.

Forward Head and Day Head:  Located at the foot of the pilot house steps is the shared head.  The head features a vanity solid surface countertop, mirrored cabinets, electric head (raw water for the ability to always have one that is not on fresh water) and a separate shower stall with folding glass doors.  There is an overhead hatch as well.

Guest Bunks:  Located along the port side the bunk room was once considered “crew quarters”.  The bunks are athwart ships with the headboards inboard.  The lower bunk has storage cabinets under the berth and one outboard.  The upper bunk has an opening port.  The stateroom has a large cedar-lined hanging locker and storage shelving. A separate and private ensuite head features solid surface countertops and a vanity with mirrored cabinet, electric fresh water head, a storage cabinets and a separate shower stall with folding glass doors.  There is an overhead hatch as well.

Aft VIP Stateroom:  Down a few steps and aft from the hallway is the Aft VIP cabin.  The cabin is large and features a walk around queen berth which is centerline with an upholstered headboard and dual night stands with storage drawers built-in.  Along the port side are storage drawers and a top shelf.  There are port and starboard cedar-lined hanging lockers as well.  Along the starboard side is a private head with solid surface countertops, a mirrored vanity and a separate jetted tub with shower and sliding glass doors.  The head overhead is mirrored as well.  The head is freshwater electric flush.

dealerListings.description:
2017 Ranger Tugs 29 Sedan MISS NORMA

The Ranger Tugs 29 Sedan is a masterpiece of innovation! The boat’s modern styling features a curved front window and an overhead glass atrium, providing exceptional visibility from the helm and main cabin. An ingenious aft cockpit seating arrangement features a reversible seat, port and starboard jump seats, and a teak table for outside dining. The opening cabin bulkhead window and reversible seat provides additional cockpit seating.

This exceptionally-engineered tug accommodates up to six adults in three separate berths, including a forward island berth with en-suite head, an aft cabin, and a convertible dinette. The vessel is powered by a safe, fuel-efficient Volvo D4 260 HP inboard diesel engine that is located completely outside of the cabin for quiet cruising. Bow and stern thrusters make docking exceptionally easy, while a full suite of Garmin electronics makes navigation a breeze.

This well-maintained boat has been cruised by its original owners. "MISS NORMA" is a Great Loop veteran and has journeyed up and down the East Coast. The sellers have decided it is time to move ashore and have reluctantly put their 29S up for sale. MISS NORMA’s fastidious owners have maintained and upgraded her as needed. The engine includes an extended Volvo warranty good until 2022, and the hull is also under a manufacturer’s warranty until then.

descriptions.title: Accommodations
descriptions.description:
As you walk down the dock, you will immediately notice the M/V MISS NORMA with her beautiful “Hero Red” hull color. She is stunning!

Enter the cockpit by stepping onto the swim platform and through the transom door. The swim platform has a Weaver davit system setup for an inflatable dinghy and motor. Outboard and stern rails were added by Ranger Tugs for added safety, and the attached rear fenders protect the stern when backing into a slip. Also located on the swim platform is a two-tank propane locker with additional space for a fuel can.

The cockpit is large, offering a reversible stern seat as well as port and starboard fold-away seating. A removable Teak table makes the cockpit a wonderful place to enjoy a meal or to entertain your guests. Additionally, the aft bulkhead of the main cabin has a fold-up window that allows the aft dinette seat to become part of the cockpit seating arrangement. When open, the window affords a wonderful alfresco feel.

The cockpit is protected by a small hardtop extension and a full Sunbrella beige bimini top. The entire cockpit can be enclosed with beige Textalene removable screens that easily zip on and off. The fiberglass cockpit sole is covered with a removable, weatherproof carpet that resembles a teak and holly floor. There are also port and starboard lazarettes, and engine access is easily made through a centered hatch that opens hydraulically. The cockpit helm is non-intrusive and is located along the starboard side forward. This helm has complete controls, and there is a large storage cabinet under it. A Nova Kool refrigerator/freezer is located on the port side of the cockpit.

The side decks are wide and offer deck extensions for ease of maneuverability fore and aft.  Stainless-steel handrails are located along the cabin top, where there is access to a sports rack for strapping down water toys. A folding stainless-steel radar arch is mounted on the forward cabin top and is easy to raise and lower. The bow is protected with stainless-steel bow rails, and the bow pulpit opens to reveal a folding ladder for beach access.

Going back to the cockpit, the full-glass entry door opens to the main cabin. The natural light and ventilation inside is outstanding, with four opening overhead hatches and two side windows. The teak cabinets and woodwork and the matching fabrics are phenomenal. The headliner is beautiful with wood features, and the teak and holly cabin sole is protected by a carpet runner that matches it. Immediately to port is the galley area with granite-look countertops, stainless-steel appliances, and food storage and preparation space that will surely please any onboard chef. The companion helm seat folds away to allow for even more countertop space.

To starboard is access into the aft cabin. This cabin is actually larger than it appears in photos and is quite comfortable. Entering it is made even easier if you lift the aft seat of the dinette. The aft cabin has lighting, 12-volt and 120-volt receptacles, storage, and two non-opening dark tinted ports.

Also on the starboard side is the convertible dinette. The inboard edge of the dinette table folds up to reveal stainless steel grab rails and cup holders. The table and seating comfortably accommodates four. The aft dinette seat also folds forward, allowing the seat to be used as exterior seating when the aft bulkhead window is open. The forward seat is also unique as it serves the dinette, and when folded forward becomes a double helm seat. Above the dinette and aft is a fold-down Majestic DC voltage television on a swivel, allowing it to be viewed from either the cockpit or the main cabin. The main helm is comfortable with a footrest, and all gauges and electronics are within easy reach. Built into a cabinet under the helm seat is a microwave oven, as well as an additional storage compartment.

Across from the helm is a seat for a helm companion. As mentioned, this seat can fold forward to allow more galley countertop space. Forward of this seat is a fold-up chart table or desk top. Under the seat is the galley’s dual-voltage refrigerator/freezer.

Further forward and down a step is the master cabin. To port is a hanging locker and storage, as well as another mounted DC voltage television. To starboard is access into the head, a large compartment featuring a granite-look countertop and modern glass raised sink with vanity storage. The wet bath features an electric macerating toilet, and the shower stall is large with an adjustable shower head. The atrium windows flood the head from above through a translucent chart table. Aft is a cabinet with access to the helm’s electrical and electronic connections.

Along the starboard side and forward of the head in the sleeping berth is a folding desk table or vanity with storage underneath. The master cabin berth features a queen bed slightly offset to port. There is ample storage under the bed, and the forward bulkhead has a mirror-fronted cabinet. The overhead has two opening hatches with screens. The hull sides are lined in a textured vinyl material, which makes cleaning a breeze. Comfortable and functional, the master cabin is a nice place to relax after a long day on the water.

description:
To schedule a private FaceTime or video tour, contact me to make arrangements.

 

In Japanese philosophy there are five elements, of which Mizu or water is one. It represents all things fluid and flowing but also relates to adaptability, flexibility and magnetism. Renamed by her current owner in 2013 and extensively refit in 2016, the 53m MIZU represents many characteristics attributed to her name. Her striking and almost military exterior exudes character and adventure. Her contemporary interior spaces are calm yet vibrant and an impressive range of entertainment features, including an on deck jacuzzi and basketball court, invoke guest interaction and energy. With an exhilarating top speed exceeding 28 knots, a reported astounding 33 knot top end and an impressive long range cruising capability, this ocean-going, transoceanic yacht is more like a ship and lives up to her name.

Not available for sale to U.S. residents, while in U.S. waters

descriptions.title: Oceanfast 174' (53M) Motor Yacht "MIZU"
descriptions.description:
Overview

The 53m yacht was custom built in 2004 by Oceanfast in Australia & was last refitted in 2016 with well over $5m USD spent. Sam Sorgiovanni is responsible for her beautiful & unique exterior & interior design. Originally named Sea Bowld, “MIZU” is built to explore the world's oceans in style & comfort. Constructed with an Aluminium hull & Aluminium superstructure, she is capable of cruising at 24 knots, a max speed of 28 knots & affords a range of 4,500 nautical miles. “MIZU” is built to some of the highest standards in the world, giving her a perfect combination of luxury & grit.

dealerListings.description:
Pampa II is a professionally kept 2016 Azimut 64 Flybridge. Owned by an experienced yachtsman and kept in ready condition.  Under 400 hours on her Caterpillar C18's (rated at 1136HP) and gyro stabilized.  This yacht is ready for her new loving owners. Her low price does not belie her condition; Pampa II is priced to see her sold soonest

Very well attended yacht, she has seen updates and upgrades throughout her life with this owner since purchased new.

  • Built to U.S. specifications, she is a 60Hz yacht with amenities for extended cruising
  • Caterpillar C18's (387 hrs)
  • Extra refrigerator in the galley
  • Kohler 23kW Generator (1633 hrs)
  • Twin Seakeeper Gyros
  • Hydraulic Swim Platform
  • Replaced outside cushions in 2019
  • Xenta Joystick Control w/bow and stern thrusters
  • Twin Raymarine MFD Touchscreens
  • Bidets in Master and VIP heads
  • Raymarine Autopilot
  • Raymarine Radar
  • FLIR
  • SAT TV
  • Sea Stairs (5 step)
  • Three Stateroom, Three Head, Crew for Two
  • Extra Fridge in Galley

descriptions.title: Pampa II Overview
descriptions.description:
Pampa II shows Azimut's attention to style and detail.  Great spaces aboard starting at the hydraulic swim platform carry onto the aft deck, up onto a spacious open flybridge, and down below into indoor living spaces that give you the comfort and warmth in an interior that fits a yacht of this caliber.  Customized to their liking, Pampa is built for the US market with 60Hz electrical systems and Tropical Air Conditioning.  The Caterpillar C18's have under 400 hours and routinely serviced and looked after.

She is designed with extended cruising in mind with amenities built in; she has an extra refrigerator in the galley doubling cold storage.  Additionally, they opted for the European bathroom by adding a bidet in the Master and VIP bathrooms.  

The two Seakeeper Gyros keeps her steady and most comfortable.  The outdoor entertainment spaces are large and inviting.  The flybridge has seating and lounging all over with more space to enjoy the 360 degree views.  Her saloon is warm and comfortable for time inside with the galley and dinette completing the living space on deck level.  Her three stateroom and three ensuite head layout affords privacy for you and your guests.  The large crew quarter is outfitted for two and has the crew separate from guests.

descriptions.title: Aft Decks
descriptions.description:
Walking up to Pampa II you see a well tended yacht with style and appeal.  The decks are covered in teak and are well looked after by the captain with expected slight wear seen in a lightly used yacht. 

The hydraulic swim platform makes launching the tender convenient and easy.  This platform also provides nice beach club style access into and out of the water.  Lower the platform about 10 inches into the water to swim right aboard.  Place a lounge chair on the back and relax with the ocean at your feet.

Up a flight of stairs to the aft deck. It is large with bulwark doors for easy access on either side.  There is a set of Marquipt Sea Stairs for boarding at dockside.  U-shaped seating for six is across the back with a beautiful teak table; fully covered by the overhang.  

• Seating with large table
• Teak decks
• Raymarine camera
• JL Audio Speakers
• LED lighting
• Fusion stereo control
• Quick mooring windlass on both port and starboard
• Large cleats
• Boarding access to port and starboard with a removable Marquipt boarding stairs
• Access to flybridge and walkarounds to bow
• Access from swim platform port and starboard with doors
• Hydraulic swim platform
• Storage compartments
• Engine room access
• Crew quarters Access from swim platform
• Two 50 amp shore power cords
• Glendinning cable master automatic shore cord retractors
• Whale shower

descriptions.title: Foredecks
descriptions.description:
Heading forward from the aft cockpit, the high handrails and teak decks lead you to the bow.  This is yet another space aboard to enjoy the yacht and water from another perspective.  Lounging on the extra large sunpads gives a wonderful unobstructed view forward while underway or at anchor.

The large walkways give easy access for line handling with cleats placed for securing the vessel.  On the bow are windlass controls for anchoring.

• Teak decks and side decks and nonskid on foredeck
• Sun pad with handrails
• Black mesh removable covers for windshield and side windows
• Cleats and chafe guards
• Lewmar Delta Anchor
• Quick windlass

descriptions.title: Saloon
descriptions.description:
Entering the saloon on Pampa II through the sliding doors shows you an open, airy, and light interior that welcomes you when it's time to go inside.  The sliding doors have dual sliders opening up to let more of the outside in.

The extra large sofa to port is U-shaped with great views out all around with the large windows keeping the view while seated.  The entertainment center is to starboard with a high/low TV and tons of storage.  The hardwood floors extend throughout the main deck.

• U shaped seating with storage and sleeper pullout underneath
• Additional seating with storage underneath
• Samsung pop up television
• Samsung DVD player
• Bose surround sound speakers
• LED direct lighting and accent lighting
• Additional storage
• Curtains over windows and aft doors
• Cocktail table with custom décor accent
• Full sliding opening salon door
• Handrail at stairs
• Condaria chiller unit control
• Condaria Personal Climate control
• Virtifrigo wine cooler

descriptions.title: Galley and Dinnette
descriptions.description:
The midships galley and settee are designed to keep the views all around with below counter storage.  The windows dominate the area keeping the views open while cooking or eating inside.  The settee is one of three dining areas on the yacht with room for four at the u-shaped settee or add a couple of stools for two more.

The galley is to port and is a very large u-shaped galley with lots of counter space.  this owner designed the yacht with cruising inn mind and added the extra refrigerator doubling the cold storage space.  There is a separate freezer.

• Marble countertops
• Hi-lo decorative privacy curtains
• Miele Induction stove top
• Miele household microwave/convection oven
• Gessi faucet
• Dual Franke sinks
• Two Isotherm refrigerator units
• Vitrifrigo freezer unit
• Drawers with dedicated plate storage
• Overhead storage
• Automatic opening window forward of galley
• Neff ventilation above stovetop

descriptions.title: Flybridge and Upper Helm
descriptions.description:
Up the stairs from the aft cockpit takes you to the massive flybridge.  This space boasts many different places to relax and entertain.  The back end of this large deck is outfitted with a giant sunpad; the first of four or five places on the flybridge.  The hardtop has a big opening skylight.

Across from the stairs is the big settee; another dining place but this one has a true 360 view around the island.  The settee sits around a beautiful teak table with storage underneath.

At the top of the stairs is the outdoor grill and sink.

Forward is yet another big sunpad next to the helm.  This has a great view forward and is a nice place to enjoy the sun and views.

Forward and to port is the helm.  Fully outfitted with Raymarine electronics including the MFD, radar, and Autopilot.  Bow and stern thrusters with Xenta joystick control on the outboard side giving great visibility while docking.

• Hardtop with retractable sun roof
• Cushioned seating and sun lounge areas
• Large table
• Drink holders

descriptions.title: Lower Helm
descriptions.description:
Pampa II is designed with two helm stations; the one on the flybridge and the lower helm station ,when you want to get out of the elements for while. On long voyages, the opportunity to have some relief from the wind takes you to the main deck inside with the lower helm station. Good visibility from here because of the design of the main deck; there are no bulkheads or walls to block your view.

This is considered the yacht's main helm with twin Raymarine Touchscreen Multi Function Displays and all of the yacht controls and navigation aides.  Controls for the Seakeeper Gyros, Engines Displays, Xenta Joystick Controller. FLIR (Foward Looking Infra Red Camera)

• Azimut vessel status display

descriptions.description:
The master stateroom is aft encompassing the full beam.  Designed for the owner's retreat, it is a living space all its own when it's time to retire.  Smartly designed to use the space best, the bed sits diagonal to the room with the extra large window overhead.  Across is the owner's settee with a great place for coffee in the morning or a desk area to gain privacy.  This settee sits under another giant window giving a very open feeling to the master.  The ensuite head is outfitted with a bidet for additional convenience.

dealerListings.description:
This 65' Fairline Squadron Motor Yacht appears to go one step further than similar sized boats on every level. Sumptuous furnishings and hand-worked cabinetry, are hallmarks of the Squadron range. Nowhere is it more elegantly expressed than in the long, wide single-level interior. A testament to the 65's ingenious flat floor design.

Having such uncomplicated, single floor levels is normally reserved for much larger yachts; however, our designers have achieved just that on this 65-footer. An elegant, beautifully proportioned Squadron awaits you.

This ONE owner vessel has all the options. It's fully loaded with low hours. She's ready with all the upgrades:

  • Twin Caterpillar engines C18, 1015 Hp each with 350 original hours
  • Hydraulic bow and stern thrusters with twin joysticks

dealerListings.description:
For some, cruising is not an option. It is a necessity. For those fortunate enough to be blessed with this affliction, we introduce the Oceanis 60. With a hull designed to perform in light coastal breezes, as well as heavy offshore winds, she has the soul of seeker.

The Beneteau Oceanis 60’s vast cockpit makes her ideal for cruising in warm waters, where the decision to swim, shower or sunbathe should be the hardest of the day. The boat’s salon is also light, comfortable and spacious with good ventilation—again perfect for exploring places like the BVI. With her performance under sail, the boat makes for a good all-round cruiser and is packed with practical features.

The new Oceanis 60 has been designed and built for the cruising connoisseur.
