dealerListings.description:
2017 Horizon PC52 Power Catamaran

Take a Horizon PC52, already one of the most popular power cat models in the world, and combine it with the detailed eye of a highly experienced yachtsman and prestige car collector. The result? A stunning engine room, tasteful decor, and a yacht that is truly ready to let you enjoy the best of the islands these holidays and beyond.

This 2017 Horizon PC52 was surveyed this summer. Every item from the bottom paint to the window snaps has been addressed by an owner that likes to see his reflection in the engine room valve covers. This is the type of yacht you want to purchase in the brokerage market. Better than new in price, and fully outfitted to be enjoyed right away.

After spending nearly a decade in the BVI on a monohull, the owner of this 2017 Horizon PC52 wanted badly to enjoy a powercat. His plans have suddenly changed and now it’s your opportunity to live the dream.
dealerListings.title: New to the market

descriptions.title: Overview:
descriptions.description:
This 2017 Horizon PC52 is truly cruise-ready! 

 

August/Sept 2020: 

REFRESH: Full generator rebuild from the zincs to the exhaust manifolds, full engine service including new raw water pumps, watermaker serviced, windlass & chain markers, showroom-level exterior polish & wax.

NEW: Brand new flybridge Eisenglass with easy-to-open zippers (!!), new canvas throughout, all new exterior cushions, and brand new salon sofa cushions … beautiful and functional.

Topping out at 22kts and cruising at 18kts, the Horizon PC52 benefits from it’s high bridge clearance to offer a dry, comfortable and stable ride. Ample views, wide side decks, and a handy Yacht Controller makes this an excellent choice for owner-operators.

Family and friends will appreciate the generous 3 stateroom layout and multiple entertainment areas from the ample aft deck dining table to the bow sun pads.

The salon offers a Great Room experience with a fully stocked galley to stbd featuring Corian countertops, a full height stainless steel refrigerator, oven, dishwasher, and a proper overhang for stools… you won’t be cooking alone.

Under the forward windows is a spacious salon featuring all brand new cushions, a pop-up television and Sonos music controlled from your phone.

The flybridge on this 2017 Horizon PC52 holds a 13’ AB tender with a 60hp Yamaha outboard, a davit and bbq space. The helm lounge is fully enclosed with brand new Eisenglass and … air conditioning! Here you will find a comfortable lounge to port and a high-boy table to stbd with stools for sunset margaritas.

Twin Cummins QSB 6.7 engines pump out over 1,000hp combined to easily propel her to a comfortable 18kts cruise while 975 gals of fuel give you the range to explore. Garmin nav equipment package with large 7616 screens make plotting your trips easy.

dealerListings.description:
2016 Azimut 50 Flybridge M/Y Fortunato

Inspired by the world of megayachts, the Azimut 50 Flybridge, with a 183 sq ft cockpit, is one of the largest yachts in her class. Fortunato, a 2016 model, is the perfect yacht for weekend excursions with the family, courtesy of the yacht’s superior ride and ample storage. 

The spacious interior accommodates guests comfortably in three cabins plus crew. The salon and dining area are guaranteed relaxation zones. A separate, independent galley is below deck and conveniently leads to the cabins.  

Fortunato is easy to preview at Turnberry Marina in Aventura, FL.

** Trade-ins considered, financing options available.

salesRep.salesMessage: The ocean is my passion and my goal is to make sure our clients enjoy every day out in the water with comfort and safety. Every day at sea must be a long lasting memory.

dealerListings.description:
THE BEACH SIDE OF LIFE

Van der Valk proudly introduces the truly innovative, patent pending BeachClub 660 Flybridge.

By ingeniously locating the Volvo IPS system in the same area as the swim platform, an extraordinary amount of exterior and interior space is freed up onboard!

As a result, the BeachClub 660 Flybridge boasts the same amount of space typically found on yachts of much larger size.
dealerListings.title: Sexy 60/66 BeachClub Series

descriptions.title: Concept
descriptions.description:
The Van der Valk BeachClub 660 Flybridge was developed in partnership with designer Cor D. Rover and Ginton Naval Architects. The ultimate aim for all was to greatly optimize both interior and exterior space onboard.

The BeachClub 660 Flybridge was built to the highest standards of Dutch quality and detail.

descriptions.title: Al Fresco LifeStyle
descriptions.description:
The BeachClub 660 Flybridge features three (3) main outdoor areas to enjoy the “al fresco lifestyle”:

• An enormous foredeck area offers various layout options, including a Jacuzzi.

• The cockpit deck is an impressive location, and includes an exterior steering station.

• The beach club aft features a smart swim platform, and a sun lounge area.

descriptions.title: Light and Bright
descriptions.description:
The overall spacious ambience is enhanced by generous use of glass throughout, with panoramic views from the two lounges and the owner’s suite. There are also numerous glass inserts in the hull, giving an additional air of class to an exterior profile which exudes modern elegance.

The BeachClub 660 Flybridge features two (2) salons. The spacious upper lounge has an inside steering position and panoramic views, while the huge lower deck lounge includes a galley and dining area, all with direct access to the swim platform via curved glass sliding doors.

descriptions.title: Complete Specs and Equipment
descriptions.description: The following sections provide highlights of the BeachClub 660 Flybridge’s specifications and equipment. For complete details on the 660 Flybridge, contact YachtCreators today at hello@yachtcreators.com.

description:
Currently completing her 15 year ABS Survey and receiving new hull paint!
ZOOM ZOOM ZOOM is a premier fast, fun, family superyacht. Her speed, draft and size make her very versatile for use anywhere in the world. All of these features plus the Quantum Zero Speed stabilizers, and aggressive pricing make ZOOM ZOOM ZOOM a must-see.

descriptions.title: SPECIAL FEATURES
descriptions.description:
Accommodations for 10 guests in five luxurious staterooms including a main deck, split-level master with impressive forward-facing windows.

Exceptional interior styling by Evan K. Marshall provides a sophisticated and elegant atmosphere aboard.

ABS classed with MCA certification, qualifying her to cruise and charter anywhere in the world.

Quantum Zero-Speed stabilizers provide the ultimate in guest comfort.

Generous cruising speed of 14 knots and a maximum speed of 24 knots.

Draft of 7’6” allows her to reach and cruise shallower waters, such as The Bahamas.

Very successful charter yacht both in Europe with the previous owner and The Bahamas and New England with the current owner.

Excellent outdoor spaces, including a sun deck with centerline Jacuzzi, generously sized bar, day head, and plenty of toy storage and/or sun bathing space.

descriptions.title: OVERVIEW
descriptions.description:
ZOOM ZOOM ZOOM is an excellent combination of speed, style, and versatility that has not only resulted in a positive owner experience but an incredibly successful charter program.  At just under 500 gross tons and 50 meters, she can easily fit into most ports and operates under the less stringent sub-500 ton class requirements.  With ABS classification and MCA certification, she is qualified to cruise and charter anywhere in the world because of her construction and safety pedigree.   

ZOOM ZOOM ZOOM has plenty of horsepower to achieve speeds that drastically reduce run time between ports when desired, and also has shallow enough draft to reach and cruise otherwise more restricted areas such as the Bahamas.

descriptions.title: CONSTRUCTION & DIMENSIONS
descriptions.description:
Aluminum hull and superstructure. 
Teak decks.

 

General

Length Overall:          161 feet (49.07 meters)

Length at Waterline:  144 feet 9 inches (44.2 meters)

Beam:                        28 feet 10 inches (8.5 meters)

Draft Maximum:         8.0 feet (2.6 meters)

Draft Minimum:          7 feet 6 inches  (2.13 meters)

Tonnage:                   465 gross

 

Capacities

Fuel Capacity:          16,288  US Gallons (61,650 liters)

Water Capacity:        2,648   US Gallons (10,030 liters)

Watermakers:           2,400   US Gallons/day ( liters)

Gray Water:              1,485   US Gallons  (5,621 liters)

Black Water:             372      US Gallons (1,465 liters)

Lube Oil Capacity:    172     US Gallons (651 liters)

Waste Oil Capacity:  277     US Gallons (1,048 liters)

 

                                Speed        Consumption per hour     RPM       Range

Maximum:                24 knots    350 US Gallons/hour       1800       1100 nm

Cruising:                  20 knots     250 US Gallons/hour       1600      1300 nm

Economical:            13 knots     110 US Gallons/hour        1200      2000 nm

Long Range:           10 knots     70 US Gallons/hour          900        3000 nm

descriptions.title: ACCOMODATIONS
descriptions.description:
ZOOM ZOOM ZOOM accommodates 10 guests in 5 staterooms. 

The full beam, main deck forward, split level master suite is an Evan Marshall signature feature, with forward facing vertical windows allowing for panoramic views, and more than 9' of headroom, which was created by reducing the depth of the Portuguese walkway above. The ceiling is appointed in cream leather with wooden trimmed coffers and gold leaf backdrop. 

The luxuriously designed master en-suite consists of his and hers bathrooms, with a marble Jacuzzi tub for her, equipped with gold and glass Lalique taps and large marble shower/steam bath for him.

The two levels of windows within the master suite provide an abundance of natural lighting, which when coupled with the high ceilings, makes for a light and airy environment. The master suite also features an owner's office with starboard facing views.

Located on the lower deck are the four remaining guest cabins, consisting of:

  • 1 x VIP centerline facing King bed with en-suite marble bathroom featuring a bathtub/shower combination
  • 1 x VIP centerline facing King bed with en-suite marble bathroom and glass shower. 
  • 1 x Queen Stateroom with en-suite marble bathroom with full length glass shower. 
  • 1 x Twin Stateroom with en-suite marble bathroom with full length glass shower. 

*The forward starboard cabin has a private entry for crew which allows crew to service the guest areas without going through the main salon.

descriptions.title: COMMUNICATIONS, NAVIGATION & ENTERTAINMENT SYSTEMS

dealerListings.description: QING is the 2nd hull and largest of the Marco Polo series and was built to Lloyd's Class with a rated steel hull and composite superstructure. Creating a larger open plan saloon and owner's suite, which features a spa-like luxurious stateroom on the bridge deck, plus an open-air viewing lounge.
dealerListings.title: New arrival

descriptions.title: HIGHLIGHTS
descriptions.description:
• Recent refit
  • All new 30 ton AC chiller plant
  • Modern & contemporary style
  • Zero speed stabilizers
  • Concealed tender storage
  • Full dive setup
  • Expansive interior and exterior spaces
  • 5000 nm range, 5800 nm economical range

descriptions.title: OVERVIEW
descriptions.description:
QING is a 45-meter Expedition Yacht, the second hull in the Cheoy Lee Marco Polo series, which beckons those seeking luxury adventure and to explore the world's remote regions while being self-sufficient and leaving a low carbon footprint. 

Launched in 2012, QING was designed by Ron Holland to merge the proven benefits of the commercial industry, with the amenities and luxury feel of yachting.  QING was designed with a single main engine that allows for exceptional efficiency and lower maintenance.

Powered by her single Caterpillar 3512B, QING has a range of 5,000 nautical miles, at 10 knots she only consumes 33 gph/125 lph, and 5,800 nm economical range. A separate Cat C7 Engine powers a 360-degree thrust schottle jet-drive for docking maneuvers and redundancy as secondary propulsion for a get home power.  Coupled with a hydraulic stern thruster she is an exceptionally maneuverable vessel. QING ensures unparalleled comfort at anchor and in rough seas, with her at anchor zero speed stabilizers.

QING’s impressive credentials allow for world cruising and have proven her capabilities over and over with the current owner.  Having logged over 100,000 nautical miles of successful adventure cruising spending much of her time in Central America, French Polynesia, South East Asia, Fiji, Australia, and Papua New Guinea, even venturing up the Sepik River.

Thoughtfully constructed with 20-millimeter-thick steel at the keel, 12-millimeter steel at the lower sections of the hull, and reducing to 8 millimeters through the waterline up to the bulwarks. In order to capitalize on efficiency, stability, and to achieve as lower GC as possible, the superstructure is completed in fiberglass with carbon fiber strengthening in high-stress areas. 

This impressive explorer yacht was built to the highest industry standards, complying with Lloyds Register 100A1 SSC Yacht Mono G6 UMS classification society rules and is MCA compliant.

descriptions.title: ACCOMMODATION
descriptions.description:
QING showcases expansive interior and exterior living spaces while remaining under 500 GT. The light-filled interior is enriched by oversized windows to provide impressive views from all areas. Designer Sylvia Bolton created a stunning modern and contemporary interior, adorned with horizontal Macassar ebony paneling and rich walnut floors. The flooring throughout Qing is “floating”, to minimize any transient sound or vibrations from machinery. This soundproofing and vibration control was custom designed specifically for this model by Van Cappellen.

This true explorer vessel offers accommodations for up to nine guests in five en suite staterooms. QING’s master suite is a private retreat located on the bridge deck. The spacious three-room suite features an open and airy lounge, bedroom with a king-size bed, an oversized bathroom with a Jacuzzi bath, and a huge steam shower. The yacht’s additional staterooms include two king VIP staterooms, a twin stateroom, and a single bed convertible gym/stateroom which is ideal as a nanny or pilot cabin.

From the aft deck doors, you enter into a large multifunctional and open saloon, dining, and breakfast area. The salon features formal dining and alfresco breakfast area, this open and airy space overlooks the aft deck and full-service wet bar. The aft windows of the salon/dining area can be fully lower to link the interior to the main deck aft deck.

Aside from being fitted out with top of the line commercial grade equipment, when the galley was being designed great attention was given to how the galley would operate smoothly, whilst offering professional services to the guests. Therefore there are three separate entrances. One exterior access from the port side main deck, for loading provisions, a second access from the formal dining area, to enable seamless dinner service and a third entrance is via the lobby to provide direct access up to the master suite, and down to the crew area.

A large library/cinema room is situated forward of the galley. This inspirational room is straight out of a National Geographic magazine, with oversize windows giving unobstructed views of the horizon, and packed full on world maps and travel guides to help you dream up the next adventure.

QING has been designed with multiple exterior spaces, to provide guests with different experiences. The aft lazarette and wide swim platform are all about water sports, diving, and easy access to the water. Outside dining is possible on the main deck aft, or on the vast sundeck, with built-in sofas and Hi/Lo tables being well-positioned under the protection of the hardtop.  The Huge sundeck also encompasses a full-beam sprawling sun pad, for basking in the sun, and a forward seating area for relaxing whilst underway. The aft deck connected to the owner's suite is all about relaxation, with wide-open decks providing perfect views from the Nikki Beach-style sun lounger, with integrated shade.

QING's unique design allows for all the tenders and toys to be concealed out of sight, in watertight tender bays, below deck level on the bow, to ensure safety and security during long passages. If desired, the tenders can also be stored on custom chocks above deck, and the spaces within the tender bays can be utilized for all sorts of toys, jet skis, surfboards, sea bobs etc.

Master Suite/Cabin 
Entering the owner's lounge via the main internal staircase, or from the aft deck, this retreat has a spa-like feel. Finished with Makassar Ebony and complimented by walnut flooring. An elegant and relaxing room also featuring a full-size desk adorned in stitched leather and a large U-shaped sofa two chairs. 

A 44" Samsung TV is mounted on a concealed automatic lift and is integrated into the Marantz surround sound system.

The Master bedroom is accessed through double pocket doors offering privacy when needed from the lounge area.  Large windows on the port side fill this space with an abundance of natural light, and double hanging closets on the starboard side offering plenty of storage.  The bathroom features a Jacuzzi-style bathtub, oversized shower with a steam generator, and full body massage showerheads. 

Lower guest staterooms
Port foreword and aft staterooms have King Size beds, starboard forward stateroom features twin berths.

All staterooms are filled with plenty of natural light through two large portlights and finished in light oak cabinetry with polished stainless steel hardware. 

The A/V system consists of 32" Samsung TV’s, Marantz surround sound receiver.
All en suite bathrooms are complete with marble floors and countertops, large showers with Hansgrohe fixtures that operate six body jet and rain shower overhead.

Gym / Spare Guest / Staff Cabin 
This cabin is currently configured as a gym/office and features a single nanny or pilot berth and en suite bathroom. Should the new owner wish to convert this to a fifth guest stateroom, there is plenty of room to do so.

The gym is equipped with Techno Gym Unica multi-function weight machine, Techno Gym cycling machine, and Techno Gym treadmill. A variety of free weights complete this functional & multipurpose room. 

Crew Lounge 
The lounge is set up with U shaped dining area with seating all crew. This area is also equipped with a sink, refrigerator, dishwasher, and microwave.

A 52" Samsung TV combined with Marantz surround sound receiver, is centrally located in this crew area. There is a 21" Sharp CCTV security monitor for watching over the decks.

Four portlights bring lots of natural light in this area. A forward ladder leads up to the foredeck, giving the crew direct outdoor access and space isolated from guests.

Laundry Room 
Located in the aft section of the crew's quarters. All newer equipment includes:
(2) Miele Professional Series washers
(2) Miele Professional Series dryers
(1) Miele Allerwash washer for delicates

Crew Cabins 
Captain (double size bed) located on the main deck forward of the starboard side guest entrance with private head.

Double engineers cabin located aft in the lazarette area, and next to the engine room, with private en suite bathroom.  In the crew area, one single cabin and one double cabin share a bathroom, and two triple cabins are located forward, with private en suite bathrooms.

All of the cabins have plenty of natural light through large portlights, each cabin has the Alphatron intercom system which is connected directly to the bridge. The cabins have Clarion stereos with CD player and two JBL speakers.

descriptions.title: COMMENTS
descriptions.description:
The 2nd hull of the Marco Polo series designed by Ron Holland, QING is slightly larger than her sister ship and was built to Lloyd's with a steel hull and composite superstructure. She is powered by a single Caterpillar 3512B with a range of 5,000 nautical miles, and at 10 knots she consumes only 33 gph/125 lph.  QING has an easily driven deep hull shape, stabilizers, and a CAT C7 driven bow thruster for secondary propulsion and get home power, as well as providing exceptional maneuverability when docking aided by her stern thruster, again from the commercial ship's side. 

QING offers tremendous interior living space while remaining under 500 GT.  She accommodates 9 owners/guests with a 3-room Master suite and open-air lounge aft of the bridge on the bridge deck. On the lower deck is a VIP cabin, a double, a twin, and the Gym, which features a built-in daybed and is able to convert to a nanny cabin.

There are accommodations for 10 - 12 Crew with a Captain's cabin on the main deck forward, to starboard of the Cinema room/Library.

Well equipped, well thought out and proven long-distance explorer, QING has benefited from an excellent maintenance program and has just completed a shipyard period including new paint, mechanicals serviced, and a fresh interior - she is ready for her new owner for the season.

descriptions.title: OVERVIEW
descriptions.description:
This yacht has just been taken in as part trade for a larger Azimut, the current owner is focused on liquidating this asset immediately. BT-2 is therefore priced under market value for a quick Sale. 


Outfitted with options like Xenta Joysticks, Seakeeper gyro stabilizers, custom sound system, and coupled with the pristine condition of this 2012 70’ Azimut, she’s a must-see for anyone looking in this range. 


Upgrades/services recently completed include; fully replaced air conditioning system, completed 2000 hr main engine service, Seakeeper gyro stabilizers serviced, generators serviced, running gear serviced and cutlass bearings replaced. 


The exterior areas both on the main and upper deck are vast. Having one of the largest flybridges in her class BT-2 boasts a large sun bathing pads, wet bar, custom sound system, full size dining table with builtin u-shaped seating, and an attractive hardtop with a retractable sunroof for soaking up the sun, or dining under the stars. 


Her interior is full of Italian flair and designer accents, the open plan layout of the main deck is complimented by a multitude of large aspect windows, flooding this deck  with an abundance of natural light. The galley is well equipped and overlooks the salon and formal dinette, which has seating for all 8 guests. 


Moving forward and down to the guest accommodation, four en suite staterooms including a spacious full beam master, ensure all guests have the same 5-star experience.

dealerListings.description: Designed and engineered to easily cross oceans while keeping her owner and crew safe and comfortable, "MY AURORA" is the perfect blend of style and sea worthiness. Safety is a priority in every aspect of the Nordhavn 120 and includes watertight bulkheads that meet or exceed ABS requirements for +A-1 Yachting service. Located in Foreign Trade Zone.

descriptions.title: SHORT SPEC
descriptions.description:
Model: Nordhavn 120 Expedition Motor Yacht  
Built Year: 2013 
Model Year: 2014  
Designer: Jeff Leishman, N.A. 
Builder: Xiamen South Coast Marine 
Interior: Destry Darr Design 
Length: 120' 7" (36.75m) 
Beam: 28' 3" (8.6m) 
Draft:  9' (2.74m) 
Displacement:  848,944 pounds 
Hull: Fiberglass 
Hull color: Pegasus Gray - AlexSeal paint 
Classification: ABS 
Engines: 2 x Detroit/MTU Diesels 8V2000-M72, 965 HP 
Cruising Speed: 8-9 knots 
Range: 5,500 miles plus 
Maximum Speed: 11.5 knots 
Stabilization: TRAC Star including stabilizing at rest 
Primary Generators: 2 x Onan 65kW and 1 x Onan 40kW 
Atlas Power System: 75 KVA 
Fuel: 17,500 g 
Water: 2,800 g 
Black Water: 450 g 
Gray Water: 450 g 
Guest: 10 
Staterooms: 5 
Heads: 7 
Crew sleeps: 7 
Crew berths: 6 
Crew heads: 5 
Captain cabin: yes 

Duty Not Paid – Currently berthed in Lauderdale Marine Center Free Trade Zone

descriptions.title: OVERVIEW
descriptions.description:
1. Extremely fuel efficient provides for a massive range of more than 5,500 nautical miles
  2. 28’ beam provides for a voluminous interior of 414 gross tons
  3. Full beam master stateroom with 4 large guest staterooms
  4. Solid fiberglass hull construction – maximum strength & minimum corrosion
  5. Two tier engine room for easy service and full length tunnel on tank deck.
  6. Large tender & toy deck on the bow
  7. Salon plus two skylounge decks above
  8. Two interior helm stations plus three wing stations (port, starboard, aft)
  9. 4 fin zero speed stabilizer system
  10. Full keel plus rudder shoe protection for all running gear
  11. Bulbous bow with underwater lights and camera
  12. Only two owners and never chartered – condition is excellent
  13. Captain’s cabin behind the bridge plus three additional crew staterooms in the bow
  14. ABS classification – 5 year special survey completed in 2018.
  15. Excellent Nordhavn full displacement design with deep draft & bulbous bow provides excellent sea keeping abilities and makes this the ideal and safe global explorer.

    Designed and engineered to easily cross oceans while keeping her owner and crew safe and comfortable, "MY AURORA" is the perfect blend of style and sea worthiness. Safety is a priority in every aspect of the Nordhavn 120 and includes watertight bulkheads that meet or exceed ABS requirements for +A-1 Yachting service. 

    Accommodations are generously proportioned and very practical for expedition, worldwide travel. The interior of "MY AURORA" is elegant and comfortable, fitted with the incredible furnishings and design.  The master stateroom takes full advantage of the nearly 28' beam with a separate his and her bathrooms.  There are four (4) additional guest staterooms on the lower deck.  The captain’s stateroom is located behind the bridge and three additional crew staterooms are located in the bow.

    The electrical and mechanical systems are engineered and built to the highest standards, maintaining reliability and ensuring safety. The meticulously maintained two-tier engine room provides complete access to maintain and repair all systems.  A full tunnel runs from the engine room on the tank deck all the way to the bow thruster room.  Easy access to high quality and reliable equipment makes MY AURORA a reliable expedition yacht and a must-see for anyone who wants to explore off the beaten path.

descriptions.title: WALKTHROUGH
descriptions.description:
Main Deck
Entering the main salon from the double opening automatic doors from the aft deck, there is a convenience bar to port and a stairway leading down to lower guest deck to starboard.  Moving forward into the very spacious salon there are opposing settees/couches to port and starboard with twin coffee tables and matching settee end tables.  There is additional separate chair seating around the settees that compliment this beautiful conversation area.  Large salon windows throughout the salon makes this area feel wonderfully light and spacious.  Moving forward and to port is the dining room with large table and seating for ten.

Ample storage with large cabinets and drawers is outboard to port along with a separate buffet just forward of the dining table.  Across from the dining room and to starboard is the entry to the foyer along with the central staircase allowing easy access to all three deck levels.  Forward of the dining table on the port side is the large chef’s galley with a separate food preparation island.  On the starboard side, forward of the entry foyer, is the separate owner's stateroom lounge with comfortable seating and entertainment.  Moving forward you then enter the spacious, full beam owners' suite, furnished with abundant storage, seating, hanging locker closets along with large separate his and hers bathrooms.
 
Lower Deck
Directly beneath the main deck is the lower deck with two guest staterooms aft.  One stateroom has a walk-around queen size berth and the other features twin berths.  Both staterooms have large ensuite heads and showers.  Two (2) VIP guest staterooms are forward, featuring king size berths with ensuite heads and showers. Continuing on, the crew area is forward and contains three (3) separate crew cabins along with three (3) separate heads and showers.  A crew lounge, galley and laundry complete this comfortable living area. The main access to the crew quarters is from the main deck galley stairway on the port side.  There is also easy crew access to each of the VIP staterooms through the adjoining bulkhead.

Bridge Deck
Starting from the outside aft seating area you enter the enclosed sky lounge with L-shaped seating to starboard with separate table and chairs to port.  Forward to port is the fully equipped u-shaped refreshment bar and large 80-inch television.  Moving forward along the starboard side you gain access to the pilothouse, the main control center for steering and navigation.  This area is equipped with twin helm chairs along with additional guest seating and table.  A day head is located aft.  On the port side directly behind the pilothouse guest seating is the combination captain's cabin/office. This cabin features a large walk-around berth with an ensuite  bathroom.
 
Upper Flybridge Deck
Starting outside and aft on this upper deck is a large hot tub/spa along with sunbathing deck cushions and seating.  Moving forward you enter the enclosed flybridge with panoramic 360- degree views. A combination galley/bar along with individual bar stool seating is located to port along with a separate L-shaped fixed settee.  All the way forward is a second helm station that duplicates the pilothouse helm and comes with another complete set of navigation equipment along with multiple helm seating.

Machinery Space/Engine Room
This area is located amidships and beneath the lower deck.  The split two-level design of this area allows easy access to much of the ship's machinery to conduct inspections and maintenance. The MTU engines along with all three (3) Onan generators are located here.

descriptions.title: ENGINES/MACHINERY
descriptions.description:
• Twin Detroit MTU 8V 2000-M72-965 HP - 4,300 hrs. (as of 06/2020)

  • Propeller shafts are 4-1/2" Aquamet 22HS
  • PSS Drip less propeller shaft seals
  • DDEC engine control system and display modules
  • Engine controls located at six (6) stations
  • 60" Hung Shen counter rotating 5-blade propellers built to ISO Class 1
  • Jastram hydraulic steering system
  • Rudders (two each) with 4-1/2" Aquamet 22HS rudder stock, supported at bottom by carrier shoe extending from each skeg

Completed in June 2018

  • Main engine 3,000-hour service (next major service is 6,000 hrs.)
  • Borescope inspection of cylinder heads by removal or injectors

  • Valve timing complete

descriptions.description:
• Teak decks for all exterior decks except foredeck
  • 300-gallon Jacuzzi spa with cover
  • Two (2) Maxwell VWC 11000 hydraulic windlasses with controls in pilothouse and at additional locations
  • Two (2) Maxwell VC4000 mooring capstans at the stem
  • Two (2) 506 lb. Aritex stainless steel anchors in stainless anchor pockets both port and starboard

  • Two (2) Maxwell chain stoppers
  • Opacmare passarel that is hydraulically operated and concealed in the aft transom steps

  • Opacmare 3,500 lb. centerline crane, extendable to 20 feet for launches to both port and starboard sides
  • Bridge wing controls (port and starboard) with engine, bow and stem thruster, rudder controls, horn and start/stop buttons

  • Custom power rotating mast and SAT domes for additional vertical clearance from the standard 56ft high down to a height of 41ft
  • The Yacht is painted in Alexseal two-part polyurethane premium coating

  • Custom fish fillet board that attaches to U-shaped stainless railing

Completed in June 2018
A five-year ABS dry-dock survey and inspection completed June 2018 that includes:

  • Electrically tested all circuits, high voltage panels and electric pump motors
  • Removed all liquid pump heads and rebuild seals
  • Replacement of rudder shoes, bearings, and seals
  • Propellers dropped and balanced
  • Propeller shafts removed and inspected
  • Removed all through hull valves and pressure tested on bench for inspector
  • Drop stabilizer fins and replaced with new seals and oil
  • Opened and cleaned fuel, black and grey water tanks for inspector to check for inspections
  • Replaced all door and hatch seals
  • Rebuilt primary pump
  • New shaft seals and four (4) new cutlass bearings
  • New stabilizer locking pin assemblies

descriptions.title: REMARKS
descriptions.description:
After taking her first debut cruise from Hong Kong to the Pacific North West, MY AURORA completed a 15,000-mile cruise to New York via the Panama Canal, through Caribbean and back to California.  In total, MY AURORA has logged over 30,000 nautical miles since she was launched.

MY AURORA is ABS classed and in 2018 completed her 5 year ABS special survey inspections which is valid until 2023.  The boat is maintained to an extremely high level by knowledgeable owners and experienced crew.

descriptions.title: OVERVIEW
descriptions.description:
BALISTA was built by Cantieri di Pisa in 2013 and refitted in 2019. This luxury yacht showcases desirable amenities and a versatile layout that will impress the most discerning owners.

BALISTA has a stunning interior. Offering a welcoming ambiance, the interior is adorned with beautiful Italian woodwork, stunning marble, and plush furnishings with a cool leather trim. Both the main salon and skylounge provide the perfect settings for hosting guests and unwinding. If seeking a private escape, the fold-out balconies off the skylounge are ideal. With sliding Asian inspired doors, the balconies also blur the lines between inside and out.

BALISTA accommodates up to 14 guests in seven staterooms. The main deck master suite is beautifully decorated and features a king-size bed, private office and his-and-hers en-suite baths. The VIP stateroom offers versatility; it can either be a full-beam stateroom with a lounge or converted to two staterooms. The yacht also has two double-bed staterooms and two twin-bed staterooms.

BALISTA's vast outdoor living spaces offer options for alfresco dining and lounging. The sundeck features sun loungers aft, a Jacuzzi in the middle and U-shaped seating under umbrellas and a bar forward. On the skylounge aft is alfresco dining and lounging. The yacht’s main deck aft has another lounging area.

The luxury yacht has low original hours and had her generators rebuilt in 2019.

Guest Staterooms
Guest accommodations include a full beam VIP stateroom (can be converted into two cabins), two twin staterooms each including a Pullman berth, and two double staterooms.

descriptions.title: REMARKS
descriptions.description:
BALISTA has recently undergone a major interior and mechanical refit in the fall of 2019 and is now highly desired within the charter market.  Her renown interior was originally dessigned by Mark Berryman and recently updated by Curtis House with Louis Anthony and Associates.

This is a perfect opportunity for a buyer to purchase a low hour turn key yacht along with a successful charter business.  
Please inquire to receive the full spec and details of the refit and her upcoming charter revenue scheduled for 2020.  

Not for sale or charter to US residents while in US waters.

Electrical Systems

  • General characteristics.  The whole system has been carried out according to:

description: PEACEMAKER is a stunning Auxiliary Motor sail. Built for comfort and not as a ship for training. The interior is finished in luxurious mahogany and stained glass with custom bronze ports. She is spectacular and there is nothing like her on the market. She offers great sailing ability and long range motoring capability. A head turner in every port and designed to sail around the world in royal accommodations. Offered for sale at a fraction of her replacement cost for a quick sale!

descriptions.title: Short Description
descriptions.description:
The family that conceived the idea to build a “yacht with character” went to great extremes to achieve their goals. The best wood could only be gotten in Paraguay so they bought a substantial piece of that country. They had a whole saw mill disassembled and put on barges. Log loaders and trucks were added to the fleet to be tugged 1500 miles up the Uruguay River. Mr. W had a landing spot for his helicopter cleared so he could personally choose every tree that would go into the making of the AVANY so that it would be worthy of carrying his beloved wife’s name (and her face on the figurehead). The ipe’ logs were milled to manageable dimensions (1 ½ times the weight of oak) along with the finest mahogany, then it was transported back down to the ocean and up the coast to the best wooden ship builder in a land of wooden ship builders. Estaliero Maccarini was chosen to build the largest vessel of his career. His sons (the 5th generation of Maccarini’s to build wooden vessels) would work with him and his whole work force to complete the vessel in 3 years. Engineers designed the transom to open into a large “hangar” to house a pontoon copter and other essential items for their comfort and enjoyment. This makes a tremendous dive platform and dingy dock while at anchor and armor plates the ship’s stern for whatever the seas can throw at it underway. Dozens of molds were made for casting the large arched windows, deck hardware, anchor windlasses, hausepipes, and even door hinges out of silicon (navy) bronze, everything bearing the name Avany. “They broke the mold when they made her” was never truer.


The beveled glass in the windows (1/2” thick laminated safety glass) and many stained glass mosaics adorning the state rooms, salon, (and even head doors) all speak loudly of the exacting detail that went into the planning of this most unique vessel.


The up to date navigation equipment is even set into a huge wooden console with large spoked wheel so as not to take away from the feeling of wealth from another age. The modern and the timeless beauty are blended perfectly into a vessel that is only 25 years old and built to last another century.

descriptions.title: Layout and Accommodations
descriptions.description:
Very large Master Suite on raised deck aft has queen Murphy bed (with decorative lights and hinged table when in up position). There is a built in dresser/desk with shelves. She features a curved coach that is 9’ long with storage underneath. The settee is 4’ long with generous storage underneath. There is a double caned door closet with drawers and shelves. Seven very large arched opening ports with beveled safety glass give natural lighting. There are two large doors that open onto a private large deck with a 14” wide taffrail cap and 6x6 spindles. The attached dressing area has four closets, some with shelves and drawers. There is a large bath with a 6’ Jacuzzi tub with shower. A gorgeous marble sink counter top with mahogany bowl sink. She has a Bidet and regular Kohler flush toilet as well.


Moving forward through a heavy mahogany raised panel door to the landing is a wide staircase to the right with handrails and spindles leading up to Bridge/Salon. Straight down three steps there is a “Captain’s Cabin” to the right under the Bridge. It has a built-in drop down desk, hanging locker with drawers and shelves and louvered doors. There is a “Purser’s Bed” with 2 rows of large drawers. The bed is a wide single or the lee board slides out and an additional mattress comes up to make a queen size bed. An upper athwart ship bunk was added but could be removed. Head has toilet and sink. Shower was removed to accommodate the extra bunk but could be re-installed if bunk were removed.


Continuing forward there is the Pantry on the right with a stained glass mosaic door. Further along one enters into a large open bar area and galley. The L shaped bar has four fixed stools with leather seats and bronze bases with foot rails. The bar has built in counters w/cabinets, sink, and shelves. The large settee that seats six is in corner. The galley has many cabinets, counters, shelves, gimbaled stainless steel propane stove, double sink, and a full size refrigerator/freezer. An arched pass-through opening at counter level into main dining area makes serving easy. Four arched opening windows and three large doors make this a great place to work and socialize too. A companionway leads downstairs to additional galley space with walk-in cooler, counters, electric range/oven, huge pantry with two chest freezers and an electric convection oven. There is a laundry room with full size washer and dryer, cabinets and shelves and wet clothes hanging area. An opening skylight/hatch brightens the area.
Continuing forward you pass a wide spiral mahogany staircase on the right which leads down to four very large VIP Staterooms. Continuing forward there is a day head with a stained glass mosaic door, mahogany bowel sink/cabinet and Kohler toilet.
Continuing forward through a stained glass mosaic door with the ship’s original name “AVANY” is the entry to the main salon. This is a very large room with curved built-in cabinets for china and serving counters at one end. These have arched caned doors and drawers and feature opaque lighting panels above. The other end has a curved twelve foot long couch with button tufted leather cushions and arched panel mahogany base. A fixed coffee table that matches the heavily built dining table is in place. The dining table is eleven feet long and the top is made from a single piece of mahogany. The beautiful table seats ten comfortably. There are eight matching arm chairs with cushions. A wood pellet stove with glass doors provides a warm glow to the room. It also has nine large arched bronze opening windows, beveled glass of course, and large doors opening up to the decks on both sides.


The Main Side Decks outside are wide, there is room for chairs, they have high bulwarks and a very wide cap rail. There are many built in deck boxes. Some are comfortable for extra seating while others have large bronze skylight hatches giving light and fresh air to the cabins below. The foredeck is a work area with large bronze winches/catheads, hausepipes and the bow sprit. There is extra room for seating. Two curved mahogany companionways lead from this deck up to a wide and long open upper deck for lounging.


The crew quarters on Peacemaker are finished just as nicely with the same materials as the staterooms, however not as spacious. The "Captains" located under the bridge has a "sliding double" that can be a single with more floor space. Presently it has an upper bunk at 90 degrees to the lower. A double hanging locker, desk with fold down top, and presently a day head. The shower could be fit back in but that would eliminate the upper bunk.


Down a private staircase off the weather deck are 2 more crew cabins. The 1st is for 2 with over and under wide single berths. Each person has a double door hanging locker with shelves and drawers. A fold down table provides a place for private dining or working on the laptop. This room has a head with shower. Forward of this is another crew room that has a set of wide bunk beds against the hull on each side. They are about 12 feet apart. Each crewman has a single door hanging locker with shelves and drawers, and the lower berths have huge drawers underneath. The foremast (inside the mahogany sleeve and trim) passes through the cabin with a shower on one side and a toilet and sink on the other. These have not been utilized by our crew but the plumbing could be completed with little effort. There are black and gray water holding tanks underneath the crew quarters and hot and cold water already. Again, these cabins are made with the same attention to detail with the heavy mahogany as the Master Suite.

dealerListings.description:
Sonny III is an ideal family cruising yacht for all oceans.
She represents the culmination of the Owner’s lifetime love affair with sailing! She is the third custom design he has commissioned and built and his third yacht in partnership with Brooklin Boatyard. The yacht represents the best quality by Brooklin’s Downeast craftsmen, from her high tech, cold molded hull and deck to her sophisticated and simple sail handling systems that allow her powerful rig to serve up thoroughbred performance with minimal crew.

descriptions.title: OVERVIEW
descriptions.description:
Sonny III is an ideal family cruising yacht for all oceans.
She represents the culmination of the Owner’s lifetime love affair with sailing! She is the third custom design he has commissioned and built and his third yacht in partnership with Brooklin Boatyard. The yacht represents the best quality by Brooklin’s Downeast craftsmen, from her high tech, cold molded hull and deck to her sophisticated and simple sail handling systems that allow her powerful rig to serve up thoroughbred performance with minimal crew.

Sonny III has among the most elegant flush-deck profiles of any yacht ever launched, with broad expanses of ½” thick teak decking, surrounding her two oval shaped, bright varnished teak cockpits, each protected from the elements with full Dodgers and removable Bimini covers. From her tall carbon rig to her flush mounted custom hatches and varnished dorade ventilator boxes, to the magnificent classic shearline, she truly turns heads in every port of call.

Her interior provides all amenities for gracious living aboard in 3 staterooms, fully equipped galley and large main salon with navigation station/office. Both the aft cockpit companionway and main companionway are equipped with a removable seated escalator, for easy access below.

descriptions.title: DECK LAYOUT
descriptions.description:
Fully aft, Sonny III’s tender is managed on custom davits that fold away when not in use. Likewise, her aft swim platform deploys hydraulically. Immediately forward of the transom are two large Lazarette hatches, port and starboard, to the full width stowage area.

The Helm Cockpit is next forward, with a full-width helm seat aft, facing the custom steering pedestal and hand-crafted teak wheel. All sail handling, mechanical and navigational controls are within arm’s reach of the helmsman and the cockpit is surrounded by the powerful electric Harken winches for easy sail trim. There are seats port and starboard and the cockpit is protected with a full dodger with opening forward window, plus a removable bimini cover for sun protection. Forward in the cockpit is the companionway to the Owner’s stateroom with instrumentation above.

Guest Cockpit is next forward with a large, varnished drop-leaf teak table at center that comfortably seats 6-8 for dining. This is the most inviting area on deck, at the center of rotation and hence the least motion, well protected from the elements by the dodger forward and bimini above, as desired. Although the guest cockpit is in the center of the sailplan, it is clear of all crew activities which makes it he ideal spot to enjoy the sailing experience. Forward above the companionway is a full function B & G Zeus MFD Screen, plus (2) MFD’s, analog and magnified Apparent Wind Indicators.

The mid-deck area is well detailed for efficient sail handling, with (2) electric ST Harken winches just aft of the spar port and starboard and efficient fairleads for all halyards. Mainsail mandrel controls are located in the same area for efficient setting and furling operations.

Forward of the mast, the foredeck is flush and elegantly detailed in teak, with (4) varnished dorade ventilator boxes and custom, flush mounted hatches to the cabins below and sail locker forward. Windlass, dual bow rollers and a custom teak bow pulpit seat are fully forward.

descriptions.title: ACCOMODATIONS
descriptions.description:
The Main Salon is amidships and full width of the yacht, with a large oval shaped teak varnished table with holly compass rose inlay at center, surrounded by a custom leather settee.  On centerline, the settee back becomes cabinetry, facing another full length couch/settee to port in this expansive, comfortable salon.

The Navigation Station is aft in the salon to port, with a full navigation desk and extremely comfortable custom leather seat facing all navigation/communication instrumentation on the aft bulkhead and complete electronics panel outboard.  Immediately aft and outboard of the Navigation Station is a double wet locker.

The Galley is aft of the salon to starboard, with a 240 Volt 4 burner convection cooktop and oven with broiler outboard, with a microwave oven above.   Two 12 volt refrigerators are fully aft, and a 120 volt freezer/ice maker is forward, all with an abundance of cabinet and counter space between.  The deep double sinks are inboard, with additional cabinet and counter space.  

The Owner’s Stateroom is fully aft, accessed port or starboard from the galley or navigation station, and via the separate companionway from the helm cockpit.  Outboard to port is a large double berth, with a wide single and extremely comfortable reclining chair to starboard.  The stateroom has generous stowage in a large hanging locker to port, fronted by a small settee, plus numerous drawers, lockers and cabinets.  The Owner’s ensuite head is forward to port, with a separate stall shower.

The Starboard Guest Stateroom is forward of the salon, with a wide single lower berth and single upper, plus drawer and locker stowage, hanging locker and opening hatch above plus and ensuite head with stall shower.  The forward Guest Stateroom is to Port, also with over and under single berths, drawer, locker and hanging locker stowage, opening hatch and ensuite head with stall shower.
